* These do not cancel sound very well - I don't believe that is part of the design anyway, but worth mentioning that if you are trying to drown out noisy, gossiping co-workers, airplane humming, or highway tire rumbling, you'll want OVER EAR headphones.

After having these bad little MFs for less than one week, I suffered an unfortunate bout of being relieved of my very possession of said precious subjects. I was working with them in my pocket & they must've fallen out & when some bottomfeeder happened upon them, his day was made & mine was ruined. If there's a God in heaven, someone very near & dear to whoever discovered their unanticipated treasure today is suffering through the final hours of their soon-to-be-over life as I type out this review & then at least whatever pleasure they may have experienced ultimately at my expense via my lost electronics accessories will have thereby been deemed short-lived. As much as I shudder to think my actions would ever bring pain or sadness to the heart or life of another, the only greater fear I hold within the privacy of my own consciousness is that of ever learning that my absent mindedness had a role in someone's effortless victory or circumstancial good fortune all while netting zero benefit directly to myself. To neglect one's self in such a way would be akin to betraying my own mother as she loves me dearly. In my eternal pledge to honor her without limitation or condition, protecting my self-interest is in effect a conscious act in treasuring her. Just for the sake of clarity, when it comes to my commitment to my mother as things pertain to honor & such, there is no task too great nor feat too challenging provided that the conditions are convenient & the terms favorably reasonable. My mother did hit me one time...we forgive, but we don't forget...let's not be foolish here...

Bought these for my 18 yr old sons birthday. They worked 2 days then one side stopped working. he tried trouble shooting them and nothing worked. Now neither side work. For the amount of money I paid for these as well as being an Apple product you would think they would be a great product. NOPE! these suck.

review title: If you think these will be easy to 'pair' with your device, think again.
review_body:
We've been so tired of using clunky headphones or the terrible fall-out all the time earbuds Apple provides, that we thought we'd order the air pods.
We have lots of apple products - an iPad, a macbook pro, and a couple i phones.
We're not luddites, BUT we're not super computer savvy either - we don't program for instance.

I was excited to give these a try. If you can get them to work, the sound is beautiful and clear. It was relatively easy to pair the pods to the iPhones. But, we still can't pair them to the iPad, and though we've had the ear pods for a week, we've only been able to pair them with the MacBook pro ONE time.

They come in a small package like a dental floss container. As it turns out, there is a teeny tiny button to press on the back of the container. It is well disguised. They could have done something better so that your hand could FEEL the teeny tiny indent button, but I had to use a magnifying glass and strong light to discover it. They should paint it with a RED dot. The only time I got the MacBook Pro to work, I had to get on my i phone and select the air pods there.

Some things to know: when you're trying to pair, make sure your ear pods are IN the case and that the case is well charged. Then open the case and press the invisible button. Look inside the case and see if the inner tiny light has changed from green to flashing white. If the case is flashing, place the case near the item you want to pair with. Make sure your iPhone is DE-selected and maybe your air pods will pair with your iPad or MacBook Pro. Maybe,

Doesn't it seem like a big company like Apple could have made these more user friendly?
We tried about 10 U Tube videos trying to get these to work.

I like that it moves so smoothly between apple products. I have a phone, macbook, and ipad.
The mic worked out okay on zoom calls - likely to work well with facetime and other video phones.
Neat features like being able to ping for location in where's my phone, and they will charge from the case.

But, the big huge downside is the battery life. I only get maybe two hours consecutively. My cowin headphones get waaaay better battery mileage and even also have wonderful noise cancelling (airpods have no noise cancelling to speak of, though they have reasonably good sound quality for what they are), but the mic doesn't work well on cowins- it has distortion. So I tend to use these on the go or if I know I'll need to speak. It will last for about one college class and that's what I needed.

I put off buying these because I thought they were over priced ear buds. I ended up buying them after christmas because I was sick of going through cheaper headsets one after the other which were never meant for the kind of use I was putting them through with virtual school. I guess whether they are overpriced or not is in the eye of the beholder. I got great use out of them so I'm inclined to say they were worth the price. However, I will also say that my daughter was really jealous of them and asked for her own pair. She is often on facetime calls with her best friend, so I told her she could buy a less expensive clone of this product off amazon or wait for me to save up. She opted for a half-priced off brand version and she is very happy with them. The look of the off-brand ones is just the same. I'm relieved I wasn't spendy on her set if what she got works well for her. I would advise buyers to check around the market, and consider the use you have in mind for them to decide what would work best for your needs. Bluetooth earbuds are not a new technology, there are many options out there - don't feel like its apple or nothing.

I didn't know if these were worth the money considering that these seemed like glorified regular earbuds. I actually like these better. While the price is high, it seems worth it in my couple months of owning them. I got these for my first semester at college to ignore people and listen to bomb ass music without looking too broke. FIrst off, these are pretty good with noise canceling. I can hear people sometimes if the music is low enough, but the sound is more muffled. It is great when I want to pay attention to my work or ignore people as they tune out people and they also make it a universal sign of "don't talk to me" which is great when I don't want to talk to others in public. Even if I'm not listening to music! The other great thing is the fact that it's quick to charge and the battery life is pretty good!
In comparison to regular earbuds or even headphones is the fact that they are easy to pack and easy to access. Headphones are bulky and generally awkward (for me at least) to have around the neck. However, airpods are really easy to put in and then when you are done using them, you put them back in the small compact case. Another is the lack of wire. I don't know about you, but for me the lack of wire is much easier. When I am in the mood to listen to something with my earbuds, I no longer need to un-knot the earbuds but simply take them out of the case. So like I said, I really like these and enjoy the easy access and the small compactness of this as well as the increase in sound quality and battery life. If I could rate this out of 10, I would give it an honest 10.

Buenas noches
No me gustó que el paquete donde venían estaba abierto hablo de la caja de Amazon

I love the way they link instantly and the sound is great, but apparently I must have small ear openings, because even after repeated wearings and trying all kinds of angles, they are not secure, need frequent adjustment and fall out of my ears with little provocation. I am just walking around, not doing sports or anything strenuous. Now that I've had them in my ears, I don't think I can return them, but it was an expensive experiment. (I have $29 ones that fit better, and I thought I would upgrade, ha)

Called apple support to get airpods replaced or fixed under warranty. The right one stopped working and nothing they recommended would fix the problem. I called back a second time and was then informed that the item was out of warranty even though I just purchased them in October of this year. Apple customer service then went to explain that my purchase date was irrelevant and what mattered was the date that they displayed in their system for a purchase between March and May. Even if that was the case, it still should be covered under the one year warranty. So then that makes me think that someone else bought the ipods in march, returned them, then Amazon turned around and resold them to me as new. Don't buy apple products. The support was rude and just by their demeanor I figured they were trying their best to get out of a legitimate warranty claim.

review title: Good device but they need to sit in your ear just right
review_body:
Great device, but make sure it is fitting your ear correct or they will fall out. I haven't been able to narrow down exactly what it is, but every now and then one will fall out or slip to some crazy angle. I am super careful but it will get me sometime, I am near positive. I have seen it quite a few times on planes where people fall asleep and wake up to find their ear bud gone. It happens.

For being a tiny little device, they seem to do pretty well on holding power. To mitigate any real possible problems, I use the charging case whenever I can. Go to lunch, charge them for 1/2 hour. Driving home from work, charge in the truck for that time while charging the case as well.

Sound seems to be pretty good. I can jack my iPhone up quite a bit and not really hear any distortion. I use these with a MPow Bluetooth adapter and I get distortion there, but I have proven it is the MPow.

Rarely do I use the Airpods with my phone in a noisy condition so i don't have much to say about noise cancellation. I also rarely use the touch features minus the "oops I just turned them off again" accidental.

One thing that is a bit annoying is in regard to the charging case. I work in an industrial environment. Somehow, that case tends to find every single metal shaving known to man. Getting it away from the magnetic pull of the case can be a real pain in the butt. I use a tiny plastic screw driver to lightly scrap it away so I don't dig into the plastic. Depending on how much you have there, This can be tedious to get out.

I am unsure who ears Apple had in mind when creating these ear buds. I like to think I have average, regular ears but these headphones make me feel like perhaps my ears are too small. I have to adjust the ear piece every few seconds so much so I had to buy one of the ear attachment pieces sold here on Amazon just so the headphones don't fall out which coincidentally has happened. Watching my $160+ Airpods fall to the ground nearly broke my heart. Aside from that the sound quality is fine... I can feel the bass. I hate the fact that there's a button now instead of the tap, tap feature the Air Pod Second generation has. So I have to deal with the ear piece constantly trying to fall out, being shorter than the Sec Gen and now I have work to find this miniature button on the ear piece just to skip songs. Listen to me sounding spoiled.... I'm at a cross. I was "forced" to buy these because my 2nd Gen was staticky and everyone complained. I thought perhaps these being the newer gen they'd be greater. Oh well!! At least people can hear me now!!

review title: Amazing Sound Quality but Some Cons
review_body:
Update: I've had these for six months and the case has stopped charging. They are essentially useless now. I would recommend purchasing through Apple so you can get another pair if yours malfunctions. Since I purchased on here and the return window is closed, I cannot get another pair, which means $130 down the drain.

This was definitely one of my best Amazon purchases. The sound quality on these is amazing even during phone calls. The charging case holds an impressive amount of charge so I only need to recharge it once every 2-3 days, which isn't very much considering I use these 8-10 hours a day.at work. That being said, there are some cons to these. The battery life of the AirPods themselves isn't the best-- you'll get 1-2 hours max. Now, five minutes in the charging case will get these back to full charge, so take that with a grain of salt. The biggest con for me has been the Bluetooth connectivity. I have an IPhone 11 so I would expect these to have no issues with connecting. However, every few times I use these, one or both of the AirPods does not connect when I pull it out of the case. It usually takes about five minutes to figure out the problem and re-connect them. It's definitely a problem when I'm trying to pick up a call on my AirPods or listen to something quickly. For that reason, I'd give these 4/5 stars. They're still worth the purchase but I'd recommend adding AppleCare so you can get a replacement if you have the same issues. (P.S. If you have an Apple watch, these do not connect independently to the Apple Watch, you will need to have your IPhone on you.)

review title: Terrible product support with unrealistic expectations of customers
review_body: My wife purchased these for me as a gift in August 2020 and they worked great up until about a month ago. At that time, the right ear bud microphone began to fail and would no longer detect sound unless I was yelling. I contacted customer support at Apple and worked through all of the potential resolutions such as updating to the newest iOS (14.6) and confirming that the AirPods were running the most recent firmware. When customer support was not able to resolve the issue they suggested that I send the AirPods in for repair. I received a shipping box and label for FedEx and sent them offer for repair. The AirPods arrived back at my home about 3 days later with a note from the technicians stating that there was nothing wrong with them. I then tested them again on my phone and my wife's phone, and with both phones the right microphone would only detect sound at a loud volume (i.e. yelling) and yet still garbled. Again I contacted customer support at Apple. This time the agent suggested that the next step would be to take the AirPods to the nearest Apple Store so that I could demonstrate the issue for a technician there. Unfortunately the nearest Apple Store is 2.5 hours from my home, though this did not seem to be an inconvenience in the eyes of the agent. At this point, I stated that it did not make sense to drive 5 hours round-trip to repair a $130 device, and I questioned why I could not send them back for repair while identifying the exact issue. The agent agreed to send another shipping box and to include on the repair "ticket" that the issue was with the right microphone. So... (can you guess where this is going?) I received another box, sent the AirPods a 2nd time for repair, and waited. Again, they returned them to me and stated that nothing was wrong with them. And again, the right microphone still does not function correctly. At this point I am left wondering why the "World's Most Valuable Company" would find it acceptable to ask a customer to take 5 hours of his/her time to fix Apple's product, instead of simply sending a replacement pair and keeping the customer happy. Apple's product support has ruined what could be a great product.

review title: Not Up to Usual Apple Standards
review_body: I bought the 2nd Generation Airpods through Amazon on launch day. In less than a month, the right earbud stopped working. I tried following all the guides and syncing/resyncing but ended up getting a replacement at the Apple store. Considering the price of these, I'm disappointed that they failed so soon. Apparently, this is an issue with many Airpods.

I found you on Amazon Prime Day, waiting In the Warehouse Deals; you said you were "Very Good" and looking for a new beginning, but I now realize it was all lies because inside, you were a mess. I tried to listen to you with enthusiasm and joy but know now you were just a toy. After a few minutes or so, I sensed the "disconnect" between us as you would just shut down for no apparent reason, but I now know you came into my life with issues that were never disclosed. However, it was likely never to be, as we were not a suitable "fit" from the moment we encountered. For one, I never felt "comfortable" with you, or did I appreciate you just "falling out" on me when I needed you to stay. Looking back, it appears all we did was waste each other's time, but I have to say life is genuinely better now since I got you packed and dropped off at Kohl's. I can only hope that you will make someone else happy and proud one day, but unfortunately, I only see pain, frustration, disappointment, and anger for anyone who gets involved with you. Therefore, let's not forget honesty remains the best policy, and deception can never be the answer to unloading one's problems.

These bevies are the right thing to do. I have tried so many other and wasted my money. The noise cancellation when worn with the mike down is not as strong as when worn upside down. Try them, it is a new experience. I wore my wired pods upside down for the same reason, they seal your ear canal to the outside noise and don’t hurt your ears. Of course every one is anatomically different, but it is my experience. Great product. A little expensive in price, but worth every penny. The sound is amazing, they did not look like they have the quality of sound, but they do.

I had mine for a week and the left earbud stopped working, no problem I deleted then connected and paired again. Still not working, charged them fully, still nothing. At that point the left earbud was giving an error that wasn't readable. I returned them for a replacement. I now have the replacement and I'm returning them today due to the fact that the original ones broke after a week. I really don't want to have to deal with this again. LG around the neck bluetooth earphones work the best imo which is what I had before these. Plus the airpod design hurts my ears and they tend to fall out alot.

review title: Just give me my proper headphone jack back.
review_body: If you still have a headphone jack in your phone, don't buy these. After buying several dysfunctional dongles with headphone jacks (both official apple brand and off brand) and off brand wireless earbuds worth over $100 combined I gave in and bought these. In general these are better than most wireless earbuds, and its better to just buy these despite the price. They are about as comfortable to wear, and they have about the same level sound quality as my $10 gummy earbuds (Gummy earbuds have good quality and last a while so I'm not saying the quality is bad, just that these are insanely overpriced). They have some convenient functions but they are not worth $150 if you can avoid it. I enjoy being able to listen to music and podcasts privately so for the sake of continuing that source of pleasure I was forced to buy these. They don't always instantly connect to your phone which is slightly inconvenient but an easy fix, and the tap to pause function only sometimes works, so I could either tap it twice and it instantly pause perfectly like its supposed to or it could fail to pause after a dozen attempts. My next phone purchase might just be going backwards to the last iphone with a headphone jack just so I can listen to my music hassle free. That or finally abandon apple after all these years and find a good brand with a headphone jack.

review title: Returned Due To Muffled and Low Volume Microphone
review_body:
I've been using some cheaper options, but decided to upgrade to the real deal. I've seen people using these in TV interviews and figured they must be the best.

Unfortunately, for my uses, which are mostly recorded video interviews via Zoom, etc., the microphone was awful. Versus a cheapo $30 lav mic, the mic on the buds sounded very muffled. No crispness on the high frequencies at all. Worst of all, people could not hear me on the other end. The output volume for the mic was extremely low versus everything else I've used. I tried adjusting the audio settings in Zoom and other programs, but still no good even at 100% volume.

Maybe it sounds great when used with iPhone or an Apple device (I don't know), but performance when paired with my Windows 10 laptop was too poor for my uses. It paired fine and I could hear fine but the muffled, low-volume microphone was a deal breaker for me.

review title: Reoccurring issues that I never experienced with the older version.
review_body:
As I lost my previous pair of EarPods (MMEF2AM/A, ordered in Jul-2018) in the plane, it was an easy choice to purchase a new pair, as I was very happy with my previous version. So, I purchased a new pair early Oct-2019. However, after using the Apple EarPods for almost 2 months, I notice that I am so very disappointed with the quality of the newer model, that I decided to write a review.

Notes:
-Although I am unhappy with the product itself and not with Amazon, the Amazon Helpdesk advised me to leave a Product Review.
-I could find that my previous version is the MMEF2AM/A, while I cannot find a version number with the latest purchase. The Order title was "latest model", so I assume this is a different model.
-I never dropped or damaged my EarPods and I use a protective cover over the charger case.
-WIth regards to my third point below: I generally put the ears back in the charger case, but occasionally (perhaps once every 50 times I use the ears) put the ears in my side pocket).

Main differences with the old version:
-It sometimes takes much longer for the ears to connect to my phone (which is the same phone that I used with my previous version). I'd say that 1 out of 10 times I put the ears in, the connection takes about 10 seconds. As I use my EarPods for work-calls, I sometimes miss calls while waiting for the ears to connect. The old EarPods always connected quickly and without problems.
-If I put the left ear in earlier than the right ear, the right ear sometimes does not connect (while it is fully charge). I can take the ears out and put them back in, but this doesn't help. The only way to "reset" the ears, is to put the ears back into the charger case, before I put them in my ears. This never happened with the older version.
-If I don't put the ears back in the charger case but put them in a pocket, my phone somehow still thinks the ears are connected (probably because they don't move much relatively from each other), which drains both my ears AND my phone. The previous version did not give me this issue whatsoever.
-Possibly partly because of the above point, but also in general (at least to my feeling), the ears battery life is much lower. The charger case has no problems, but I honestly have the feeling that my new ears have about half the life of the previous version.

Asides of the above, the EarPods work well and have high quality sound, hence I suspect that the item itself is not broken in any way. Instead, I suspect design and/or software flaws.

I am very disappointed with this, as none of the above issues ever occurred with my previous version. Initially, I hoped it was both a one-time thing (which it wasn't) and that the flaws came with being "a newer version" and were possibly fixable by software updates, but after using the ears for almost 2 months and seeing the issues reoccur, I wanted to give back this feedback.

I received authentic Apple AirPods and I even received them a day earlier than expected! These are definitely an upgrade from my original Gen 1 AirPods that I purchased back in 2018, thankfully. Once again, pairing to my phone is phenomenal and the battery life is long. Of course my old pair wore down over time but I believe, I’ve gotten good use out of them and I’m confident this pair will last just as long. I like the hey Siri feature and that I can even control the volume with Siri now, very cool! Sound quality is just as good as always, overall I’m satisfied. Oh, and one more thing ! These things attract dirt and dust like a magnet and scratch very easily, therefore I highly recommend a case or some form of protection for them.

BUYER BEWARE! I ordered these Apple AirPods, which are sold by Amazon and not a third party. They arrived in perfect condition and sealed box. However, I called Apple Customer Support and spoke with an Apple representative to confirm they were true Apple and not fake. In order to confirm this I asked about the serial number on the box, then compared to the serial number on the charging case, right earbud, and left earbud. They have three different serial numbers! That confirms the suspicion, these are not a matched set! They have been tampered with and then resealed to make it look like a new product. At best these are used, seconds, or refurbished and mismatched when putting the set together. I am returning...don't pay this price for refurbished. Also notice the description does not disclose this. This is fraud.

review title: Pricey but great fit, and the sound is very very good
review_body: These are the Apple Airpods Gen-2, not wireless charging, and not the Pro (I hate the round rubber tips that everyone seems to love). First of all, these are very easy to use. The sound is fantastic. I suppose I am an audiophile since I love music... the sound is clear, balanced, and the bass is very present. The advantage is that the design of these airpods does not require you to jam rubber tips in your ears, and the quality of the sound is therefore dependent on the tips staying in place; which, most of the time they do not. If I have to keep reaching up to readjust the buds for a better sound, what happened to the hands-free experience? Also, I am not sure what some people do to get the Apple Airpods Gen-2 to fall out of their ears. I have literally tried to accomplish that and unless you go full-on metal head mode I don't think you can do it. So, let me make it easy for you, and do take my word... I have read reviews by people who were using, and listening to God knows what. Pros:Great sound, easy to use, nice size case... some tws earbuds have those cases that are so huge, YEESH! Also, very secure and comfortable fit. Cons: the Voice Memos app on the iPhone is affected... when you record with those on you will get a sound as though you were on the other side of a phone line and not in the same room. They are great for working out and listening to your music, podcasts, etc, also, only one gesture per earbud. I found the Ticpods and will try them today. They have the same Apple design... no crazy rubber tips. You get a lot more gestures, and if the sound is like that of Apple I will be returning my Apple airpods. Update, the sound of those pods was not in anyway bad, the fit was ok, slightly too large, and I prefer the opened balanced Apple sound. The tick pods gave me more of the Bose sound, it’s not as opened, it’s more compressed. Last... I don't care about noise cancelation... unless I am on a plane; and even then... I hate to purposefully deprive myself of one of my so important senses; it intuitively feels like a really bad idea. Here is an update A few months later: The Apple AirPods are simply a wonderful product. I know they’re pricey but they’re that good. The sound, the fit, the look, great

I purchased these as a gift for my wife. At first, she wasn't sure if she would use them but they quickly became her favorite accessory. She uses them when watching TV on her phone and needs to walk away for a moment with no need to carry her phone with her; she hooks them up to our Apple TV and can freely move around without having to lug anything else around. She connects to her work laptop and uses them when grading her students' multimedia projects. They fit her well (I have a pair as well and they are quite comfortable), they have outstanding battery life (she's not one to remember to charge accessories, but these last weeks without a need for a charge), and they just work. Who has time to fiddle with bluetooth connections and such? Highly recommended.

I like these AirPods, but they have some serious downsides in my mind, that are quite frustrating. What I like: the sound quality, when they are working properly, is very good. They fit well in my ears and feel secure, and the battery charge is pretty impressive (I only charge the case occasionally, and it keeps the earbuds charged for as long as I need them). The audio quality for phone calls is good, and it's nice to be able to talk on the phone hands-free. There is virtually no noise cancellation, but I didn't buy them for that purpose. I wanted comfortable, easy to use, high-quality wireless earbuds.

What I don't like: I have an Android phone and have had consistent issues with the bluetooth connection. In fact, I returned my first pair of AirPods and exchanged them for a new pair because of this. Sometimes (especially when I'm walking outside) the bluetooth connection will cut out, then reconnect. It usually does this several times. When the signal reconnects the audio sounds echo-y, like one earbud is lagging slightly behind the other. It disrupts the sound quality and is really annoying. This only happens when I'm out walking, and usually only in certain places, so I wonder if it's an issue with signal interference. I don't have this problem when connected to my MacBook or my phone when I'm listening to music indoors or while I'm driving. These are advertised as working with Android phones, so I'm very disappointed with the issues I'm having. My replacement pair has the exact same problems.

If these issues continue to be disruptive I will have to return these as well. It's very frustrating to have my music cut out and the poor audio quality. I'm hoping that the audio issues are signal interference from specific locations and that they'll work in other locations, because I really do like having the wireless earbuds for music and calls. I'm hopeful, and would appreciate any fixes others have tried, but I'll have to return them if this continues to be an issue.

review title: Great for Calls and casual Listening; Tough for a Hardcore Workout
review_body:
The title of this review kind of says it all--these AirPods are amazing for everyday things like phone calls, listening to music while travelling, and other low-impact activities. The sound is really great, linking them to my iPhone was super easy, and the battery life is really good. If you're looking to ditch the corded headphones and you're someone on the go, this is a fantastic purchase.

All that said, I originally bought them because I was looking to hit the gym pretty darn hard to get rid of some of my Covid padding. When I work out, I get really sweaty (ya girl is working HARD), so I find that halfway through my workout, they don't always stay in my ears very well. I make it work, but there are some points where the ear piece feels like it's going to come flying out of my ear if I don't stop and adjust.

I'm still going to give these 5 stars because they are pretty awesome, and I use them for so many other thinks outside of working out, but if you're looking for some AirPods to use while working out and you're a sweaty Betty, I'd look to get ones that are built with a bit more of a sports mode.

There are much better reviews to read, but I wanted to clear something up. First, I’m not an audiophile and mostly am using these to listen to books as I do other things. However, they are much easier to use than other wireless earbuds I have bought before; just pair once and they remain paired. Take one out if somebody is talking to you, put it back in and it starts up in the same place. Battery is long lasting and just a few minutes of top off can get you more hours. You can hear background noises of course, so you don’t feel isolated. I really can’t speak to noise cancellation so I gave it a three star review but others are more knowledgeable.

The one thing I wanted to clear up-these earbuds are 2nd gen, but maybe the case is 1st gen. I think that is confusing some people. The charging light is inside and it’s wired to charge, but when you look under settings you can see the actual earbuds are 2nd gen.

Mine were new and definitely from Apple. Oh, and I have small ears and normally find earbuds painful but I’ve been wearing these for two days without issues. My only problem is that I have very long hair and if I sweep it back I sometimes knock one out. When I’m home it’s normally in a ponytail so no big problem. I may get something to keep them around my neck when I use them outside of the house and it’s something long-haired men and women might need to think about.

I didn’t realize how annoying having tangled wires for earbuds was. I should have gotten two pair, one for home and one for out. Oh well, next Prime Day!

review title: Best Apple Product I purchased from Amazon
review_body: I was a little skeptical about buying apple products from amazon because I wasn't sure if it was going to be legit. But I was definitely proved wrong. I was originally going to purchase my AirPods through apple but to be honest, I found a cheaper price through Amazon. So I decided instead of paying $159+$29 (apple care+) + $15.04 (tax to ship to my location) Equaling it all out to $203.04. I decided to buy the AirPods from Apple's store via Amazon for a total of $136.72 ( $128.98+ $7.74 (TAX). I also purchased AppleCare + for Headphones ( 2 Years ) Protection(A Must Have whenever buying anything Apple! It will save you a lot of money and heartache if something goes wrong!!) for $31.32 ($29.00 + $2.32 (TAX). So the total price of everything would have been $168.04 ; But I had 2 gift cards (one for $18.68 and one for $136.72) which knocked the prices of the AppleCare insurance down to $12.64 and the AirPods down to $0.00. The great thing about being an Amazon Prime Member is most of the time you don't have to pay for shipping!!!. I read the reviews for these AirPods and a lot of people were saying to make sure it says "PRIME" before you buy and that was definitely worth it. I've always wanted a pair of AirPods ever since they came out but I didn't want to rush to buy them when my other apple headphones that came with my iPhone 7 Plus (that I've had since 2018 with no problems) were working just fine. Of course with any pair of wired headphones, there is always the wires getting tangled. But luckily with AirPods you don't have that issue. I wouldn't say I'm cheap but when it comes to products that are of excellent quality and are built to last like Apple; It is definitely worth spending a good amount of cash for them. So all in all, I save a ton of money and my AirPods work like a dream. I Love My New Toy.

I feel very disappointed that I am one of the very few on the planet that don’t just love these EarPods. I can’t have them in my ear more than 10 minutes otherwise they begin to create lots of pressure in the inner part of my ear Cartlidge starts to throb and hurt very badly. Not wanting to give up on them I purchased rubber padding for the earpiece but it’s basically pointless to have those covers on the earbud if you’re planning on taking them out and putting them in the charger. Because then you have to takeoff the cover store those without losing them and put them back in there for the charge for me it’s too much and I just want to head and had to return them. Looks like it’s just the old fashion for me until Apple comes out with something that has more comfort.

Please note that this review is not for the quality of the product.
I just received my air pods, which I was really excited to get. When I opened it I immediately thought something was off because the box was not sealed. I did read some reviews about getting used products, but I figured that wouldn't happen. It's never happened before. When I opened them, I could see they are so obviously used and gross. I almost could not believe my eyes. The fact that this could be sent to someone is just crazy! I am returning and buying somewhere else, like I should have in the first place!

review title: Love the sound but Bluetooth is unreliable
review_body: On the whole I really like my Apple AirPods with one exception. However, it’s an important one. The Bluetooth connection is sometimes unreliable. Most of the time it works well sensing which device I’m using and transferring seamlessly between devices. But, last night I finished listening to a Podcast on my phone, turned off the phone and got my iPad to catch up on some other items. There was no way I could get the AirPods to recognize my iPad. Very frustrating. This has happened several times.

review title: The most overrated earbuds on Earth
review_body:
Decided to see what the hype was all about and bought Airpods. While they are admittedly aesthetically pleasing and pair nicely with Apple products, I just don't see what the hype is about. They're incredibly uncomfortable and fall out of my ears whenever I walk or laugh (and yes, I have tried orienting them differently in my ears to no avail). If they're not falling out, they feel incredibly loose and like they are about to fall out. I looked online to see if other people were experiencing this and how to fix it, and found some articles about how airpod covers are available to allow the earbuds to stay in place. For the price I'm paying for these earbuds, why do I need to buy another $13-20 product to make the $135 product actually possible to wear? Absolutely ridiculous. Why should anyone have to exert additional effort to actually make the product functional? After messing around with the Airpods, I finally gave up and put on my ($10 ) earbuds that have the same sound quality and infinite more comfort than Airpods. I really do believe that Apple is the only company on this planet that can get away with its product being designed so poorly that methods to make their product wearable have to be created.
I also noticed that switching the Airpods from my Macbook Air to my iPhone XR was a hassle. I would have to tap the option to forget my Airpods on my iPhone and then reconnect them after using them with my Macbook Air.
Finally, I know people who swear by these earbuds. They work well with other Apple products and look good on the wearer, but I don't think that these reasons justify the price tag or all the other cons I've listed above.

I LOVE THESE! I have been wanting to go wireless for running, and my partner and I wanted to each wear one of the set as we ran together. He was paranoid that these would fall out, so we tried two other types first (jaybird Runs - JUNK in every way, and Apple beats - way too quiet and hurt my ears). I finally convinced him to give these a shot, and they have been amazing! They do not budge at all when we run, the sound quality is impeccable, and they are soooo comfortable! The connectivity is somewhat less strong than the Beats, but plenty enough for our use. A few people mentioned about the microphone quality being subpar, but I have to disagree! I used them today during a conference call for work, while I was walking on the treadmill, and I came through loud and clear without background noise. So happy with this purchase - wish I had done it sooner!!!!!

Do not waste your money on buying these. They are passive, which means you hear everything around you so no matter how high you turn up the volume, you'll be able to hear everything around you.

The microphone is TERRIBLE. On video call meetings I get complaints that the audio is fuzzy when I talk and that I sound like a robot. Keep in mind these are paired to a brand new 2019 Apple MacBook Pro, so there should be no issues, yet there are. If these can't work with a product that the SAME manufacturer produces I can only imagine how bad they are if you're on PC.

Battery life is also horrible, they die within a few hours of being charged and they get you with the gimmick that the case extends the battery life to over a day or something. Dont fall for this marketing ploy. Sad waste of ~$150. Wish I had bought something else.

I received the AirPods today and they paired to my phone as expected. I used them for about 30 minutes and then charged them (they still had a charge of about 60%). I opened the case next to my iPhone and the phone showed them connected and fully charged. I then took out the AirPods and placed them in my ears and started an audiobook. The sound came through the speakers in my phone and the AirPods weren't working. I opened settings on my phone and did everything I could find online to pair them after unpairing as the phone required me to do because it couldn't connect. I went to "get product support" on the order page and spoke with customer service who walked me through the same steps I already took to try and pair the AirPods. I could not get them to pair. My wife's AirPods paired fine with my phone so I ruled out a problem with my phone. Amazon customer service connected me with Apple customer service and they are replacing the AirPods, however, I have a $215 credit authorization on my credit card pending their reception of the defective AirPods which must not be damaged. I don't think this is the norm for Apple products but sometimes you get a bad product. I think Amazon should have sent me a new Pair with case and taken the defective ones as any local store would have done. Amazon shouldn't have referred me to Apple for replacement. The lesson I learned is that you don't ever click on "get product support" but you do click on "return and replace".

I'm fully in the Apple Ecosystem: iPhone, iPad, Mac. It was time to replace my wireless headphones and heard so much about the Airpods and so many friends love them, decided to stay Apple. Indeed Airpods work great with Apple products. If that's all you're going to use them for, don't hesitate. I've bought and returned 3 other airbud products. Primary issue was the device staying in the ear, then sound quality. Airpods stay in your ears and the sound is very good for the price point.

HOWEVER........I'm primarily interested in wireless help with hearing especially my TVs. I do not have Apple TV. One TV is a smart Samsung with Bluetooth and the other is Panasonic that I've added a Bluetooth transmitter. Anything that's not Apple has no issue pairing with the TVs. When it comes to pairing the Airpods, my blood pressure rises each time. Sometimes they pair, sometimes not. But that's not the real issue. The Airpods do not have independent sound control. If you're using an Apple device, you control the sound through the device like phone, watch etc. However, my TVs (two major brands) do not have volume control for output. Very few TVs do. So if the volume is too high or too low, I need to disconnect from the TV, pair with an Apple device, get the volume where I think I want it, then disconnect, then re-pair with the TV and hope the volume is somewhere near where I like it.

I spoke with Apple about this and their response is buy an Apple TV device. That way the Airpod will pair and sound can be controlled. In my case, I would need to buy 2 Apple TV devices. The low priced airbuds come with volume control, apparently there isn't any technology magic required. Apple is choosing to not include.

I'm still undecided about returning the Airpods. The fit, comfort and sound are well worth the price. The volume annoyance is a reminder each time I use these things that Apple is not the customer focused/design company we think they are. Before I bought the Airpods, I spoke with 3 friends who use and highly recommend. Each one told me I would be able to control the volume with my iPhone or iPad. After talking with Apple, that is not the case.

While on that subject, since my last Apple purchase this is the first time in about 18 months that I've needed to talk with Apple support. What has happened over there? Four calls in two weeks; each time I feel like I'm speaking with someone that is just reading a script and doesn't really understand the issue. The solution to most any issue seems to be, buy something else Apple. As a long time shareholder who's gone through a lot of stock splits, I appreciate the focus on Apple products but come on, there's more solutions to improving an Apple product than buying another Apple product.

Very great product. I have been using it only for one day but dang the quality is amazing, but these are not too different from the gen1 AirPods. If you have the money I recommend getting these l, you will not regret!

When I first bought this I was super excited, when the package showed up, there was NOTHING in my box, I contacted Amazon and Apple right away. Amazon was willing to send me a replacement, which was really nice. THEN, when I got that package, the AirPods didn't work. I let it charged for over two days before using, I tried setting it up on my iPhone XR which literally took over 30 mins for it to sync, THEN when it finally synced I couldn't hear out of the left AirPod, so then I unsynced it and had to go through the whole 30 min process again, and then I decided to get it another day with charging, and then they both worked for about 2 seconds and then it started to get static and the right one stopped working. Now, I have to send my product BACK to Apple for them to repair it. Honestly, save your time and either buy it at a big store. Don't buy through Amazon.

review title: Sound quality is not so great
review_body: I bought these so I could listen to music while out on walks with my dog and Zoom calls. After using them for a few months, I have some thoughts on this. I have a pair of over the head headphones that are noise cancelling. They were cheap relative to the air pods and they deliver great sounds when I play music on them. The airpods were only okay at 3x the price of the headphone. They don't fall out of my ear while walking or jogging as some people have reported, but if I go to tuck my hair behind my ear or rest my head on something, they fall out because of the long tail it has on them. The AirPod pro looks like it would sit better in your ear and not get easily knocked out since it has a much shorter tail. All that said, I tried cheaper blue tooth ear pods and they were terrible and kept disconnecting from my phone so I gave this 3 stars because the sound is good enough for walks and stays connected to the bluetooth. The battery life for using it for calls is pretty short (around 2 hours) but I've never run the battery out on them listening to music. The wireless charging case recharges them very fast and I consider that a huge plus. The AirPod pro is likely much better but I'd still buy these over the AirPod 2 just because of the huge price difference.

review title: Buyer Beware! Read the Description Carefully!
review_body: These aren’t exactly “latest model,” using my definition of those words, or my 13 year old daughter’s definition. My daughter specifically requested the most up-to-date generation 2 AirPods on her Christmas wishlist. Shopping in a hurry, I saw “latest model” and a reference to 2nd generation and bought these for her. The actual AirPods themselves are gen 2. They do have a model number with a “2” in the second digit. However, THEY DO NOT HAVE THE EXPECTED WIRELESS CHARGING CASE! This is basically a gen 2 AirPod, in a gen 1 case. If you do a browser search on how to identity gen 1 from gen 2, you’ll quickly find an Apple support webpage listing the methods for identification. The case is one of those methods, along with model number etc. This explains why my daughter expected the “latest model” would include the wireless case. This feels like an intentional bait and switch by Apple. I do not think any of this is Amazon’s fault. I ordered a pair for my son online from a National Retailer. That one also said “latest model” and the same thing happened. So, if you are buying these for someone who specifically requested gen 2, don’t get this one. Read carefully and get the one that specifically mentions the wireless charging case. At this point my daughter is so disappointed with her gift, I am going to have to buy the wireless case separately, which in the end, is going to cost way more. Don’t make the mistake that I made. On a positive note, overall, these are great quality genuine Apple headphones!
Lost the left then both - wont charge, wont reset and wont pair of course. They worked with a new iPhone 12 pro for the time since purchased in Oct 26, 2020 - dead and replaced on June 19, 2021

I bought these for my wife as a present and she absolutely loves them. She has smaller ears and it's hard for her to find comfortable earphones. She really liked the ones that come with iPhones but she would catch the wire on everything. I bought her some Bluetooth ones that just didn't fit right so she never used them.

These were exactly what she needed. The fit her smaller ears and keep her cord-free. They utilize touch controls on the side of the headphones that are not buttons. The case is just the right size to carry them in a pocket or purse and it even charges the headphones when you are storing them, even when the case is not plugged in. So, when it says "wired" in the description, it means that you charge the case via USB but when you unplug it, it has its own battery that charges the ear-buds. She's been using them for a couple of weeks so far and I don't think she has charged the case more than once.

Yes, they are a bit pricey but they are definitely worth it to make her happy.

I bought these under the impression they were new unused AirPods which they weren’t. They had been named by a dude who’s name showed up on my iPhone when I went to use the AirPods for the first time. I googled his name and found him on Instagram! Shady on the part of Amazon! On top of that the AirPods don’t hold a charge for more than 3-3.5 hours. Not acceptable. Returning.

I wasn't sure how much I would use or like the AirPods Gen 2 when I first purchased but have really been pleasantly surprised by how often I reach for these over my old trusty wired ear buds.

Fit: I had no issues with fit; the Apple EarBuds always fit comfortably and snugly and these were no different. I would say though that if the EarBuds didn't fit then the AirPods probably won't fit either. I've seen some custom accessories to make more snug but imagine they wouldn't sit right in the charging case.

Connectivity: Apple has really made the bluetooth connection seamless which was always a tedious process on other wireless ear buds I've used. I just pop them in my ear and within seconds I hear the chirp that they're connected - huge plus.

Sound Quality: I would say the sound quality is better than good but not quite excellent. I think there is room for improvement in that regard. No interference or anything but the base isn't very deep.

Battery Life: Again, I would say this is any area where it is better than good but not quite excellent. On a full charge the case and buds will get me through about a day and a half before recharging but that is with relatively light usage. It is convenient that they are recharged with a lightning port as I have them everywhere now (work, car, office).

Overall, I would say I'm very happy with my purchase of the AiPods Gen 2.

Dope....once you get them you’ll realize you really needed them ...lol I know paying $150 is crazy but you’ll see when you get them ...only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is because the AirPods keep disconnecting on Group FaceTime ...other than that everything good

This thing performs well in all of the standard headphone categories like:
- great sound quality
- stays in ears (at least mine - i'm a normal sized guy, 5'10" 190lbs)
- great battery life
- fast charging
- great noise cancelling
- works amazing as a 2-way (i use it for conference calls while walking down busy streets and airports all the time and rarely get people saying that background noise is distracting)

Where this thing blows away all competition is just the magic of how effortlessly it works. Open the case lid and your phone asks you if you want to set up your new AirPods. Once it's set up, pop them in your ear and whatever you were playing on the phone goes to your AirPods. Then pop them out and whatever you were listening to automatically pauses. You get helpful little sounds when the battery starts running down. To charge them, just pop them back into their case (which itself stores probably 4 or 5 full charges for the headphones) and they'll be workable again in about a minute, and fully charged in about 10 minutes. (I haven't actually timed this, that's just anecdotal)

I get that there are much cheaper wireless headphones out there but anyone who has ever used AirPods can tell you these are another level of convenience and quality. Once you use these you'll never go back to non-Apple products, at least not for use with an iPhone.

review title: Convenience and ease of use is amazing, fit and sound is EH
review_body:
Pros:
- I carry them everywhere in my jean's pocket because they are so small
- They "just work" no lag or trying to get them to pair to bluetooth, they always connect and work

Neutral:
- Battery life is good for how small the buds are, but the case is great in that it has extra charge capability

Cons:
- I can only wear them for 45mins tops before my ears start to hurt. Very uncomfortable any longer than that
- Sounds quality has a lot to be desired. I cant tell if they are just bad or that the Beats PowerBeats Pro are amazing.

Overall:
You cant win. If you want longer lasting, more comfortable, amazing sound wireless buds, you need to get the PowerBeats Pro. But if you get those, you will NEVER bring them with you because the case is HUGE. I ended up buying both these airpods and Powerbeats Pro and couldnt be happier.

Though I dislike the fit and sound, these are still 4 stars because for basic podcasts, quick music at the work desk, calls, and of course how small they are, it more than offsets the cons. But trust me, there is no way these could ever be rated 5 stars.

Ridiculus !!! Box was opened and the sticker not gluing anymore, the cable is dirty and with marks of being plugged, the box of the earplugs have many scratches in both sides....definitely a used item. No doubt. While checking again the item in Amazon, to see if I have missed something, it was there "NEW". Sold as new, but is it just a used item. This might be my bad luck or just Amazon trying to get rid of things returned after Christmas.

I used them for about 1 month and all of the sudden my left pod won’t work anymore. When I first got them the left pod always had a hard time connecting to the case and often gave me the red exclamation point error message. After messing with it I could usually get it to connect, but now it has stopped working all together. Because Apple wants $90 for a new pod, I might as well just buy a new set. I loved them for the month I had them, but I’m so disappointed to have spent that much money on a pair of headphones that I can no longer use. I will not be buying another set. I just wouldn’t recommend.

These are used AirPods. I received a box that looked like it had been in the garbage and the AirPods themselves were dirty. I was not expecting used AirPods and I even checked the description to make sure I didn’t miss anything. No where did it say they were going to be used or refurbished. So I contacted support. I asked why the item was used and it didn’t say it was on the description and the rep really made it seem like they did not want to answer my question and just asked me if I could return the item. I asked if they were authentic Apple AirPods and if they would be new and she said yes so I agreed to get a replacement. The replacement was also a used or refurbished pair. Oh and the original pair I received wouldn’t even pair to my iPhone. I’ve returned both sets and am still waiting for a refund weeks after I returned them.

When these work, they do exactly what you want them to do and are awesome. Unfortunately, when they don't, they can be extremely frustrating if you are in the middle of a phone or video conversation and they just cut out or sound comes out of only one earphone. This happens to me about 1/3 of the time. At this price, they should be more reliable. Also, if you are walking with even the slightest of breeze, they amplify that to the point in which it is very difficult for the person on the receiving end to hear you.
EDIT: I have had nothing but problems with these and ended up just throwing them away. A waste of a whole lot of money.

Good sound, though I’m 63 and not an audiophile. But you can’t beat them for convenience. Great for walking due to Siri based controls. Siri also let’s me look unfamiliar words while listening to audiobooks, which I love. Only earbuds I’ve ever found that stay in my ears, yet so light and comfortable that I forget I have them in. Not exactly a fashion statement in my opinion. I joke that, with the white protuberances going down out of the years of an older guy, it looks like his hearing aids are melting. But yeah, very very good and reliable product, pairs perfectly every time with no dropped signal, really excellently designed all the way around.

If I hadn't authenticated the serial number, I'd seriously think I was sold a counterfeit product. Since this is an authentic, new product, I'm just left to believe the product is mediocre at best.

I regularly use my air pods on both iOS and Android devices. The air pods connect relatively quickly and easily to both, but especially with other Apple devices. (For some reason, the max volume is significantly lower on my Android device.) The Bluetooth range is not great with reception starting to break up if you move more than 4-5' away from the phone. The sound is pretty clear, but less than 10 weeks after purchase, individual ear buds will cut in and out or get static-y even while sitting stationary next to my phone. Like other reviewers, my individual ear buds don't seem to charge evenly with one often dying well before the second. I've also been disappointed with the battery performance. The ear buds re-charge quickly when inserted into the case and I'd say I can probably get 5 hours of run time between charges of the *case*, but I struggle to regularly get more than 2 hours of run time per full charge of the ear buds (and oftentimes not even that). Finally, I have no idea how people wear these all the time as I found the shape of the air pods to be tremendously uncomfortable. (Though I am aware accessories exist to mitigate this issue)

I truly don't understand the effuse praise heaped upon air pods. I am deeply underwhelmed.

NNO AIRPODS IN THE BOX!!!!
Bought it for my wife’s Christmas present. When opened there was NO AIRPODS in the box !!!!!!!
What a horrible experience!!!! Waiting for refund.
The only things in box were instructions and charging cord.

review title: Bluetooth freedom is way better than being wired to the music source
review_body:
Easy to set up and easy to use. Pods have a substantial weight and feel good in the ear. Sound quality is high fidelity. Intuitive controls -tap for next selection, ask it to raise or lower volume and it does. A full charge gives ample battery life for a +/- 6-hour listening session, Recharge quickly and, generally worthy of the Apple brand. Recommend buying an aftermarket accessory kit with a silicone cover for the charger and a lariat to allow you to hang the Airpods around your neck for a short time when you want to.

UPDATE MY REVIEW: I have been enjoying my Apple AirPods for almost a year now and I want to add this to my initial review.
After purchasing my AirPods, I purchased a silicone sleeve for the charger case with came with a Caribiner and a lariat to hold the Airpods and allow them to hang around my neck when I took them out of ears
A few days ago I attached the carabiner to the belt loop of my jeans for an afternoon of cycling and at the end of the day, I tossed the jeans into the wash not realizing the AirPods were still attached to the belt loop. After washing the jeans I threw them in the dryer and within a few minutes, I began to hear something solid banging around in the dryer. Upon opening the dryer, I found the silicone charger case - empty. Searching the clothes, I discovered the charger case with the Airpods inside.
I took the silicone case and the AirPods Charger out of the dryer and was very sure they were destroyed - they were NOT! I opened the case and put the AirPods in my ears and was shocked to discover they worked as well as ever and they had no indication of damge at all.
The AirPods are obviously water-resistant - My thanks to the Apple engineers for anticipating they would be used by careless old men who do some stupid things.

The AirPods arrived in great condition, nice packaging but they do not stay put in my ear at all. I attempted to wear one around the house while doing light chores and it fell out several times and required adjusting multiple times. I should have known that these wouldn’t work for me, my regular corded earbuds do the same thing. I don’t imagine that I’d be able to workout or do much of anything without them falling out. I’ll be returning them and purchasing a much more inexpensive pair that allows me to adjust the ear cover for a better fit. Good product for most, but not a good fit for me

Update 5/14/20
So these are advertised as being the latest generation. My case that came with the AirPods have a model number that would indicate the case is 1st generation. The AirPods have different model numbers that would indicate that they weren’t manufactured as pair. There’s something fishy with these although they work. Check your numbers......my settings on my phone show a model number that is in fact different than what’s printed on the actual device. I wouldn’t be surprised if these were refurbished, all the different serial numbers confirm that this wasn’t an original pair because they have different manufacture dates

review title: Super handy and convenient, everyone with an Apple device should have these
review_body:
As an audiophile, I resisted getting these for a long time. But they don’t sound bad and the convenience and ease of use is off the charts. AirPods are a very well designed and useful accessory to any Apple device. Battery life is acceptable given their tiny size.

I bought them first for my wife, who’s never had true wireless ear buds and doesn’t care as much about sound quality as me. She’s also not particularly into gadgets and tech like I am. She loves these things like the sister she never had.

We both find that they fit well, stay put, and are comfortable, and our ears are very different size & shape.

When I’m doing serious listening to music, I have other earphones I can use. Otherwise, I reach for the AirPods because they’re so easy and a joy to use. I’m happy I bought them.

They also work great for cellular phone calls and for Zoom meetings.

Let me start this review by saying that I'm using these pods with a Blackberry Priv that has an Android OS, so take that FWIW. Maybe they aren't compatible, or optimally compatible, or whatever since they're an Apple device. I don't know, but the point of having them is to be able to listen to my phone without wires, and they don't allow that very well.

The range is limited, like less than a few feet, and depending on where I'm using them it's less than that. For example, I can be at the gym on an incline bench, set my phone on the floor next to me, and the podcast that I'm listening to cuts out. Maybe there's interference from the gym's piped in music - they work well enough when they're about 10 inches away from me in the rack on the elliptical machine.

This afternoon I was washing my car in my garage. When I was washing the tires I left the phone on the hood of the car, and when I went to wash the rear tires, my podcast cut out. I ended up turning them off them and using the speaker in the phone.

The only time these pods really work is when I'm driving and I have my phone on my lap. YMMV depending on how, when, and where you use them.

Love them! I was concerned at first that they would fall out but they don’t. I use them to work out lifting weights or cardio without them moving. Craziness. Great sound and battery life. If you are looking for noise canceling then these are not the headphones for you.

***Update 10/6/2019***
I have had them about 5 months now and the last 2 months I am having issues with the left ear pod staying charged or connecting. I have gone through all the troubleshooting online of cleaning and reconnecting with it only to happen again and again. It is very frustrating to have both pod's 100% charged at night and then during my workout in the morning the left one dies 20 minutes in.

Well I bought these “New” off amazon. We were having problems with one charging. Apple was great trying to help, but the serial # is not an Apple # and apparently these were sold as new but they were refurbished. Tell tell sign, this is not our Apple name we assigned them... LIES AMAZON!!!

review title: Be leery. These so not appear new in box.
review_body: Completely annoyed. I purchased these as a Christmas gift for my daughter. Website made it look like they were coming direct from the Apple store in new condition. I just took them out of the shipping package and this is what the box looked like. Not sealed in the clear wrap. Nasty stuff all over the bottom of the box. A sticker placed over another one that tells me these are “New item.” I’m not believing it for a second. I don’t know what is going on, but I feel like something fishy just happened. As far as AirPods, I have a pair and love them. Just wish this pair would have been new in the package instead of this nasty thing. Am returning today.

I finally got tired of trying to find ear buds that could compare to Apple, and I decided to just spend the money and get Apple. I’m not sorry that I did, but I do wish that I had gotten the Pros. I had Apple phones for years & always promptly gave away the included wired earbuds that come with the phones. They never ever stay in my ear if I move my head at all. The reason I went ahead about bought these anyway is because I found that I could purchase a set of silicone hooks that slip over them to hold the bud in my ear. They are perfect with that little hook which reminds me of the build of my favorite Bose headphones. The hook is simple enough to put on, however…. I don’t love having to take them back off after each listen because they obviously won’t allow the bud to charge in the case. I knew that before I ordered and simply didn’t think it would be as annoying as it is. Bottom line, the ear buds themselves are awesome; best wireless listening experience I’ve ever owned & I am not at all sorry that I bought them. About a month after I got them, my daughter bought the Pros. I put them on one time & was immediately sorry that I hadn’t chosen to pony up the extra money for them. They are worth it & in my personal opinion, actually sound better due to the complete seal in the ear.

I love these air pods. Price finally came down from the original price when they first came out so I went for them. The last pair of head phones I owned was back when the wired version was around so it’s been a few years. These sounds great.. love having no wires. They stay in my ears no problem. I didn’t want noise cancelling headphones so these are perfect. I like them especially at the gym hearing what’s going on around me. I feel almost unsafe with noise canceling headphones.. battery life is great. I highly recommend buying these

Update:
The right AirPod has been slowly going bad over the last couple weeks and now it’s always at 1% life when I open the up to pair them. That’s with 100% charged case. They’ll start charging when I open the case... great while they lasted. Used indoors only to.. disappointed especially for the price I expect better from Apple

review title: Wish I had splurged for the Pros
review_body:
They do get a little sore in my ears after a while. I wish the battery lasted just a smidge longer. I generally use them while doing things around the house, and they will last a few hours. The sound quality is very good. The input quality is better than the standard corded ear buds. It picks up my voice better. Noise cancellation is comparable to the standard ear buds.

My biggest complaint is that these were not clean when I received them. I opted for the open box to get a discount on these. The description indicated that the box may have been opened and possibly damaged. However, it did not indicate that the item had been previously used. And especially considering the current pandemic situation, particular care should have been taken to ensure that the item had been cleaned. I spent about 20 minutes scraping ear wax out of the ear buds! Gross! And if you have had any Apple ear bud before, you know that it is very difficult to get into all of those tiny little crevices! I sincerely wish that Amazon had taken a little more care in the processing of returns such as this!

Greatest earphones ever!

I don’t know how I ever lived without these, seriously, not just the earphones but the great little case that they come in that charges your ear buds even when it’s not plugged in so perfect to have when you’re traveling.

The ear buds not only allow you you to call people by simply saying “hey Siri” but it answers any questions, it reads and composed text messages if I ask, it plays music etc. etc. Simply ask and you shall receive.

I can now cook with my hands full while dancing to the beat of any song I ask Siri to play, ask Siri to take notes for me or even help give me recipe ideas.

Once you’ve used these you will also ask yourself how you ever lived without it as it makes your life so much easier.

The sound is fantastic along with the noise reduction and whomever I’m speaking with hears me well.
These are pricey but I assure you they are worth every penny you pay.

When I initially got the headphones, I was fascinated by how awesome they sounded. I would put them on and could basically hear in HD and the noise cancellation works, even with no music on.

Buuut, that only lasted a few months. I bought them Sept. 2020 and up until about a month ago (2/21), they worked perfectly. Now, the sound only comes out from the little side speakers and not the main ones (it happened to both headphones), so the sound volume was reduced DRAMATICALLY.

Now they just sound like cheap wireless headphones (maybe worse), and the only way to be able to hear it a bit better is by twisting it so the side speaker is facing my eardrum, but that makes it loose, so it falls out easily.

Safe to say, I’m most likely not going to be buying Apple products from Amazon and might just stick to buying them directly from the Apple Store, because it seems like I got a defective pair and I’m not alone.

I’ve had my own for over a year now and my sister had been dropping subtle hints about getting a pair such as( hey, buy me AirPods) or (did you buy my pods already?) or my favorite ( get my AirPods or I’ll take yours!). Siblings are so funny, anyway since she took mine I figured, this would be the best time to buy a new pair for myself so I did and they arrived rather quickly. Now guess who’s got two thumbs and his old AirPods back?…… THIS GUY!!!!!!!

These pods were a Christmas gift to a 14y/o who was waiting months for them. They worked half a day. Went through the hassle of 2 appointments at the Apple store, the first trip they said it was the case and gave me a new one without testing it first even though I requested a test. Well, they never worked and had to schedule another trip there and they said it was one of the earpieces and when I explained the first trip the clerk said "it's never the case" and was given a new earpiece. Now they work. If known this would have happened and the poor Apple service....I would have rethought the purchase.

Ever since I switched from Android and PC, I've become Apple-centric. Since Apple products like Apple products, I decided to buy some Air Pods. Amazon's Prime Day price of $114 finally brought them down to what I considered a little bit better price, so I bought them.

Pros:
1. They connect very quickly with all my Apple devices.
2. The sound quality is a few steps above some of the other ear buds I've had. The stereo is good, and while they don't have enough bass for me, they don't sound tinny either.
3. They fit fairly comfortably in my ears, although the right pod fits better that the left one does. Maybe I have an oddly-shaped left ear!
4. So far, neither pod has fallen out of my ears. However, I've worn them mainly in the house, so I don't know how it would be if I was running. That, I'll never know because I don't run anywhere.
5. The case opens very easily, and the pods are fairly easy to remove. I really appreciate this because my Jabra case is so hard to open that I would often have to get my husband to do it for me.
6. I love, love, love the fact that I can say "Hey Siri," and get so many things done. I was watching an Amazon Prime show on my iPad Pro the other day, and I told Siri to mute the volume, and she did it! However, when I said to un mute, that didn't happen. Maybe I need to figure out some other terminology for that. When I said to rewind a couple of seconds, it did that, too. This is a really great feature.

Cons:
1. Other than the price, the one thing that kept me from buying these was how silly they look with that long white stem protruding out the ear. One person said they look like a hair dryer, and they do. I have noticed that the Air Pods Pro have a much shorter stem, and thus they look more normal. I guess when the get down low enough in price, I'll probably buy them and give these to a friend or relative.
2. They don't have noise cancellation, which I would really love to have. I guess I'll have to wait for the Pros for that.
3. I didn't realize that they had wired and wireless charging versions, and I ended up with the wired ones. However, I bought a wireless charging case for less than $10 from Amazon Warehouse, so I'm going to see if that works.

Overall, other than some of the cons I mentioned, I really do like these. They connect quickly, have a pretty good sound, and the hands-free Siri feature is great. However, I would say that if you can afford them, you should get the Air Pods Pro because they look better, and they have more features. If you can't, these would be a great stop-gap measure until the Pros go down in price.

This is my first pair of AirPods. I love them. They are life-changing! The AirPods arrived in less than 24-hours of ordering. They were packaged in a sleek, white Apple AirPods box. I did not buy the "noise-canceling" AirPods, so I cannot rate that feature, but as far as the product appearance, sound quality, ease of use, great fit, easy to pair on Bluetooth, etc. I wholeheartedly give these AirPods 5 shiny gold starts.

You’ll have to buy a new pair in under a year. I bought 4 sets for me and my kids less than a year ago, and 3 of them don’t work anymore, already. They worked great, while they worked. Then in 6 months, 1 air pod starts dying periodically, then permanently, then the other. Now only 1 pair remains, and it’s only because I hardly ever use them. These were a waste of money.

review title: The default choice for a reason
review_body:
I held out for so long on buying a pair of AirPods, I always felt like they were priced a little too high for what you get at the end of the day. I get it now though, their value is more in how these work with all your other Apple hardware than it is from the AirPods themselves.

These are still to this day in 2021, one of the smallest charging cases of a pair of true wireless headphones, even though the design is unchanged from 2016 when they were announced alongside the iPhone 7/7 Plus. That’s pretty incredible for back then.

In the box, you get a standard USB A to Lightning cable, the AirPods and charging case. This is the 2nd generation AirPods with the H1 chip on board for “hey Siri” functionality. It works really well and allows the AirPods to seamlessly switch between any iOS devices, TVOS, WatchOS, and newer MacOS devices. If they are connected to your iPhone and you pull out your iPad to watch a quick video, the audio from that video would be automatically routed through the Airpods. This is after the initial setup, which only requires you to hold down the pairing button and then follow the prompts in the on screen pop ups. If you open the charging case within a few inches of an iOS device, you get a cute little pop up that will display the battery level of both the AirPods and the case. Apple’s software is good and pleasant to use, that is why products like these are worth their premium prices- the tight integration of hardware and software working together to create an amazing experience that is largely unrivaled today by any other tech company.

The sound quality here is good, the open style of these headphones makes it easy to hear the world around you (this can be both good and bad). There are better sounding headphones for this price, but not any that work this way. If sound quality is of great importance, perhaps look at the AirPods Pro or wait a few months until they refresh the base level AirPods with a design that has the ear tips (this is a rumor, but it’s probably a safe bet that the entry level AirPods will get a major design change).

These also tie into Airplay 2, and this allows for audio sharing where one iPhone can play audio on 2 sets of AirPods. There are also other little perks like Siri will read out you iMessages to you (this can be paused or turned off entirely). There is a cool accessibility option called “live listen” you can enable it in control center. This will use your iPhone’s microphones to play the audio it hears into the AirPods. This kind of gives it an ambient or pass through mode like headphones with ANC have.

If you do pick these up in 2021, just be aware that this is a nearly 2 year old product and could be replaced with a newer version as soon as March. No one ever really knows what Apple will release or when, but the chances are high. That said though, the H1 chip is likely to still be used in the soon to be released pair, so there shouldn’t be a huge difference in terms of new features.

Had a bout of bad luck with Apple's AirPods:

First Pair
After about three months, one side stopped working completely.

Second Pair
The first pair was still within Amazon's return period so I got a replacement set. This pair wouldn't connect to any phone whatsoever. So, I returned them.

Third Pair
The third pair finally worked as intended. Sounds great and I love the battery life. Much better than other Bluetooth equivalents especially for an iPhone. Just wish that I didn't have to go through the misery of two returns!

review title: These don't appear to be an authentic Apple product
review_body:
I was excited to see that these Airpods were part of Amazon's Prime special the other day. I already have a pair but the battery life doesn't quite make it through a full work day. I justified a 2nd pair to hold me over on a full days work.
When I initially got the order I didn't notice anything odd about the packaging. It looked and felt authentic.
