After taking a careful look at the product, I noticed that the lid was not completely flush with the body on the back side of the charging case. I compared the Apple Air Pods I already have to these and the weight and durability of the plastic seemed different but I couldn't tell for sure. After charging them all night the charge only showed 88%. That was the defining moment that I realized I purchased yet another dupe on Amazon. Don't waste your time and purchase directly from Apple.

I purchased these for my husband for father's day. I kept going back and forth between the Bose SoundSport and the Airpods. I have the QC35 and I love them for work since they are noise-cancelling. For my husband's purposes (at work, when doing yardwork, etc.) he did not headphones at the QC35's level. Overall it was the ease of the airpods and the charging case that really drove my purchase. It's been one week (opened them early) and he loves them-- the only hesitation I have is him losing them (so compact!). For everyday use and ease of use with apple products I would definitely recommend.

review title: Love them minus the popping noise
review_body: The battery life is OK. Thankfully, I use one at a time and I can put one away to charge and pop another one in my other ear. I wouldn’t suggest wearing both and expecting to wear them for a long period of time. They do charge very quickly though!! I love that. I noticed this popping noise pretty soon after they arrived. Within the first 24 hours. I contacted Amazon customer service about, spoke with a very nice gentleman who assured me he would call the next day to follow up after suggesting I disconnect and re-pair them with my phone. This did help initially but within that 24 hours, the popping/crackling noise was back. Of course, he never followed up. I went ahead and kept them after reading this is an issue with AirPods. Didn’t want to go through the trouble of returning just for it to happen again. Anyways, I figured I’d hit em where it hurts, the review. Despite the noise, they are great. I use them quite a bit BUT if you find another brand that does the same thing for half the price, that makes sense too!

I expected to not get the same sound quality out of these as the wired version since they are the same design and it's bluetooth. But, along with my now HD audio Amazon music account (thank you Apple!) the music sounds great! I like the integration with Siri so that she reads texts that come in and announces calls. Double tap feature is configurable, like my left ear is stop/start and right ear is next track. Also, if you take one out, whatever is playing, music or video stops and then starts when you pop it back in. Additionally, I like this "old" design because those new squishy rubber tipped things never stay in my ears. Battery life is pretty good. I haven't measured it, but I can usually get away with all day with occasional listening. Cons:
sound is a little less bass heavy, but there still is some, definitely not "tinny". Battery could be better, but I mean they are tiny. Very little to complain about really, definitely happy with this purchase, I recommend them.

review title: Its okay..but there are definitely better ones out there
review_body: I bought this as a birthday gift for myself and my friend has been raving about AirPods so I wanted to try it for myself. The sound quality is okay but when I listen to death metal, it just sounds like people are screaming. Noise concellation is okay but not as good as the airpod pros. The battery life is not good. I used this airpod for a few hours and it needs to be charged again. This is only for people who is okay with charging their airpod after a few hour use. There are other earbuds that have a better sound quality and a longer battery life.

review title: Excellent Buy on the way to Applepod ProsS
review_body: I finally decided to take the plunge and purchase these when they were on sale. I just couldn’t see paying the full retail price for headphones, no matter how good they were supposed to be. Despite the less than perfect fit in my left ear, I do not regret my purchase, the sound is excellent whether you are listening to something, or speaking on the phone. While the battery life can always be improved on devices like these, the wired case makes charging easy (I love how the sound slowly decreases to let you know you battery cycle is nearly at an end). While the cheap in me will likely never be able to justify paying full price for a more advanced and more comfortable version, which the pros are reported to be, I do see me one day upgrading to the Pros if I catch a good sale.

review title: Why have I waited this long?
review_body:
I am an android user, and I generally stay away from Apple products due to their higher price, and inflexibility of integration with non apple products. My son had a pair of pods, which I tried with my Samsung Galaxy phone - when I saw how great they are, I had to purchase a pair for myself, and I have had it over over a month now.
1) Pairing is effortless and quick
2) Quality is amazing - crisp, clear
3) Battery life has been great so far. I've been listening to audio books while walking for 2-3 hours at a time, and battery lasted more than that without needed to recharge in the case
4) I don't feel that they are in my ears. They are so light and comfortable, that sometimes I have to touch my ear to make sure that they didn't fall off. Any other pods, my ear starts to feel an annoying dull pain after some time - but not with these. They've been in my ear for over 3 hours without any discomfort.
5) Speaking of falling off - they won't. The design is fantastic, so unless you're flicking them off on purpose - they will stay in the ear. I had worked out with them (push ups, stomach crunches, etc.), and never had to adjust them.
6) I am not looking for noise cancellation features with pods, because when I go for walks, I want to be able to hear ambiance noise for awareness. While they not intended to block noise, they do a good job in transmitting strong and clear sound. I often times have to reduce the volume to be able to still hear ambiance noise when outdoors. Next to a busy street, I do need to increase the volume, but that's expected.

I don't use the gestures much, so can't comment on their responsiveness/usefulness, but I feel like a fool for wasting money on knock off brands for a third of the price, to see how terrible terrible their quality is in comparison (sound quality, pairing dependability, comfort). Also, this is not a wireless case, so you will need to charge with a cable.

Overall, this is a solid piece of engineering that I would strongly recommend over any knockoff or other competitors.

review title: They work great when they work !
review_body:
Very nice . Only ear buds that fit

* update * after 6 weeks the batteries wouldn’t charge completely .Apple support directed me 3 hours from my house for repair . When I told her there’s a Best Buy 4 miles from my house , she confirmed that they could handle it ! I was told if the problem was not my fault , they would be replaced on the spot . In reality , if you don’t purchase from Best Buy , they send them in for repair .
I really like the product , and am looking forward to their return .
** update ** just received repaired airpods . 2 days . Excellent service . They failed again after one use . Same problem . Bestbuy offered to return them again . I declined. I bought a new pair from Bestbuy and I will return the haunted pair to Amazon tomorrow .

My third set of airPods died and were just three months old. This time I decided to contact Apple online support as many of my friends have had terrible support at the local store. After 35 minutes of back and forth with the online support is was determined that I had to supply my credit card and mail in the airPods so they could determine if they needed to charge me for repairing my airPods that are under warranty. I did not want to supply my credit card as it should not be needed for a three month old product that is under warranty. Therefore Apple informed me that they could not help me. I was very disappointed as now I'm shopping for another brand and having to spend money that I just spend three months ago. The service from large companies just keeps getting worse and worse; which is to bad. We spend a lot of money on these products and just want to enjoy them!

review title: I got a used pair! Gross! Left one doesn’t charge! Do not buy
review_body:
I received them and they are used!!!!!! They pulled up as “Angie’s iPod”. What is this! And they’re dirty! Do not purchase from this seller! Used and gross. I do not know how they sound I won’t wear them.
It’s been 2 weeks! The left one runs out and does not charge all the way up! I am returning!

review title: Yep! These are Great! Just a few Minor Drawbacks, but Otherwise are as Advertised!
review_body: As many have said before, the batt life on these Airpods is nothing short of great! The case is the key to extended life. Comfort? For most people, the comfort level is outstanding. My left ear does have issues different from most, so the unit keeps popping out during exercise. Installing the little slip covers seemed to correct this. (Silicon based) I've heard a few complaints regarding sound quality. Not so for me. I just twist them a bit so the main speaker is directed to my ear canal, and the sound is about the best I've heard. These are great for the price, and I predict the Pro version prices will go down after the holidays if you want to hold off and spend up to 50% less. The only real difference with the Pro version is the end pieces. (Will stay in your ears better than standard.) I paid $165.00 for these. Worth every penny I think!

review title: Were great, until they suddenly stopped working
review_body: Had the airpods for 4 months and they were amazing. Sound quality was great, felt very comfortable, the whole nine yards. I loved these earbuds. After 4 months, without warning it just stopped working. It connects to my Samsung phone, but it doesn't play any sound. Ok weird, I'll just put it back in the case and take it out again (disconnect then reconnect). Still the same issue. Try to unpair the earbuds and pair them back and still nothing. Put the earbuds in the case and held the button to reset it until it gets that amber light and still nothing. I then thought ok maybe it's because I'm not using an iPhone, so I get my old IPhone 6 and try to connect it to that and see if it fixes it and what do ya know nothing. I kept resetting it so many times and I finally got one earbud to play sound. Right earbud plays sound and left one doesn't, ok cool progress. I tried resetting it a couple more times and now the left one plays sound but the right one doesn't. Continued resetting it and now the right earbud plays sound but the left one doesn't. It sucks, but at least I can still use one earbud. I'll continue to try and see if I can get both ear buds to work and if I do I'll update this review, but until then It's a 1 star for me :/

After having these for about a day, it feels amazing to not have a wire. I can move freely without worrying about pulling my headphones out accidentally, especially while I am at work carrying boxes.

One complaint that some people have is that the airpods fall out or don’t fit their ears. I haven’t had this problem, and they fit perfectly. I haven’t tried to run with them in yet, so I’m not sure how they stay in while I am running.

I do advise being careful when taking them out of the case though. They are really small and they could fall if you don’t grab them when they come off the charger in the case.

They connect to apple devices EXTREMELY easily. All that is required is you open the case and hold it up near your device while the case is opened, and pair from the popup on your phone. Regular bluetooth connections are possible by holding the button down on the back of the case.

review title: It's Airpods, everyone should have a pair
review_body:
This is my third pair of Airpods, which may seem strange to some, given they first came out in 2016, however if you use these as much as I do you will wear the battery out over time. Since the charging case is pocket size you can always carry these with you and since the case contains a seperate battery they're always charging in your pocket. Connecting is a breeze, 1. Open flap, 2. Do you wish to connect airpods ? -> Connect 3. Done...

Airpods with or without wireless charging case?
I have a wireless charging pad and a lightning cable next to my bed and rarely used the pad for wireless charging of these, would just stick with the lightning charged case if you don't need a full charge every day. I only need to charge weekly and since you can charge the case without having the airpods in the case I sometimes plonk it in the charger when I'm going to do stuff around the house and want to use the airpods.

Airpods or Airpods Pro ?
I have both kinds and I really like both types, for different scenarios. When using public transport or really need noise cancelling the Pro's shine, however for extended use, > 1 hour, when riding a bike, out for a walk, eating and listening I go for the classic airpods, they're just more comfortable to wear, you barely know they're there....

Inevitably, one of the airpods always stops working, but it is not always the same one. It swtiches ears. It takes several attempts to unpair and re-pair to get them both to work. I wear them to run. I have sometimes gotten less than a mile into my run when one quits working. It is ridiculous. I paid the extra money thinking they would function as expected. Disappointed.

review title: Don’t get fulled by the price.
review_body: I had first generation AirPods and they lasted almost two years. I was planning to buy new pair but I wasn’t in the rush because they still worked, sound was decent and battery would last me 2-3 hours before I had to put them on the charger. Somehow I misplaced them so instead of looking for them, I decided to buy a pair on Amazon. They were cheaper than Apple store so I thought I was getting good deal, NOT! First of all, sound is really bad, there is static in the background and I’m hearing an echo of some unknown music (not what I’m listening). Last drop was battery life. First time it happened I thought that my daughter might have used my AirPods and drained my battery. This time I fully charged them, charging station and AirPods were 100% charged. I placed them in my purse where they will be safe, and not borrowed by teenager. They were sitting in my purse for 4-5 days, not being used at all so they should be fully charged. Well the light was green for a few seconds, then it changed to orange. Pods were not connecting to my phone even though I tried to connect them by holding button in the back of charging station. I even tried to forget device on my phone, then reconnect, but at that point orange light on the charging station disappeared, and that happens only if they are completely drained, dead. Today they will be going back to Amazon. I don’t want another pair, I want full refund, and I’ll be buying a new pair from good old Apple store.

I am extremely angry about this purchase! I anxiously awaited this package as I accidentally washed and dried my son's air pods. The package finally arrives (1 week after ordered Amazon Prime) and the only thing in the box was a charging cable!!!! No air pods at all! Are you kidding me, Amazon? Either you have a thief working for you or you think you can rob me! The box was torn on one end. I was okay with that but then I opened it and it was empty cardboard inside with a charging cord underneath. I didn't even order a charging cord. I could not be madder!!!!!!! I would give it a negative 1,0000000000000000 stars!!!!

I opened them and thought “Oh no, the charging case is missing and realized that they’re wired. All the the pictures and reviews on the selling page are of wireless AirPods. The box looks like wireless AirPods but they’re wired. The ad says AirPods with wired charging case... wired AirPods don’t have a charging case at all so even though the title said wired everything else about the ad and the description is more wireless AirPods. I feel extremely misled. The ad even talks about battery life and talk time which doesn’t even apply to a wired set of AirPods.

First the good- sound quality and ease of use are amazing. Yes, this was a genuine Apple product, I verified the serial number before I opened the box. They connected to my phone right away, no weird extra steps to pair. They sound amazing. They are not noise canceling- I thought that wouldn’t be as big of a deal as it is. Now for the reason I’m upgrading to the pro model- the fit is awful. The right AirPod hurts my ear after only a few minutes of use. The pro model has more fit options and noise cancellation. I am glad that I tried these because they are by far the easiest Bluetooth ear buds I’ve ever used, the sound is great, and if they fit better I’d be 100% sold. So there you go. Give them a try for sure, but once you do, you may want the better set. And GET APPLE CARE. I work on the repair side of things and we send them out all the time. I would not think to get these without the added protection.

I have problems with the Audio becoming desynced and some annoying issues with old firmware. There was also a rather nasty bug with the model I received. It nearly made me deaf - if you don't know to update the thing (which is a problem for Android...) then you might suffer some hearing damage. I used them for days with the bug and was on the cusp of returning them. The bug is that the audio defaults to maximum volume - with any device (iOS, Android, etc) - until the software is updated. This volume setting reverts to maximum everytime the device enters a power saving state. They sleep aggressive (like maybe 5 seconds of silence). So, if you're streaming music and it takes more than 5 seconds to fetch the next song -- you're getting blasted at full volume force from a device directly inserted into your ear. Very painful. Again, if you just update them they're fine. I was able to reproduce the problem on multiple devices and it wasnt until I updated my airpods that the problem went away. Now the only problem I have is the occasional desync of audio. It's easily fixed and a lot of other people have the same issue sadly. I have noticed that holding the phone differently affects the rate at which desync occurs, so probably just something with signaling. Leaving the phone flat and uncovered/held remedies my issue. When they work, they're really nice. But overall the initial frustrations really took it's toll on my ability to like this product. Hopefully there's better QA on the next generation.

I have always considered AirPods a waste of money until I actually got them! I got a new job of course where you can’t listen to music so I got these to hide the fact I was listening to music because basically you have to wait your turn to bag groceries for 10-30 minutes depending how busy it is and just stare at the customers and look around and wait your turn, and having these makes the day a lot better! Also I go on lots of family road trips and earbud cords get in the way when your eating or doing something but these AirPods are so easy to use and there’s no cords to bother you! And when you need to charge them and your on the road you don’t need to fight to charge something because if the case is fully charged it can charge the AirPods from dead battery to 100% in like 15 minutes and then when you get to a hotel you can charge your phone and AirPods for the next day! And a charger comes with these too so I recommend getting a wall charger with two usb plug ins so you can charge your AirPods and iPhone at the same time, and charge everything at once!

review title: Still not up to the level of quality one would expect from a $140 pair of earbuds.
review_body:
I am comparing these to my ~$40 SoundPEATs Q29 model i bought 2-3 years ago. Its almost as the the pros and cons for these two competing earbuds are reversed.
Apple AirPod PROS:
Battery Life: ~5 hrs listening time. And the case holds charge for, i don't even know how many charges. I haven't counted but its significantly higher than the SoundPEATS.
Ease of Charging: SO SIMPLE. The magnet inside secures the airpods to the charging electrodes. The soundpeats lose their connection to the electrodes constantly so it never fully charges either earbud. I would have to constantly twerk and manipulate the buds in the case to make them charge.
Ease of Connecting: The chip helps them connect without any problems.
Audio Latency while watching video: NONE!!
Custimization: Really like that you can customize the controls for either right or left AirPod. However, would like, more gestures I'd like to customize. Like, instead of just a 2 tap, also have a 3-tap. That way you can customize 4 controls. I'd really like to be able to repeat a song, or turn up and down the volume.

Apple AirPod MEHS:
Audio Quality: Just a little better than the SoundPEATs... not much but it is noticeable.

Apple AirPod CONS:
Connectivity: Because of the Apple's forced upgrading, we can't use these on devices running anything before iOS10. That means I can't connect to my First Gen iPad. (the thing is still chugging along and great for streaming NetFlix, Hulu, and Videos.
Comfort: The SoundPEATs were super comfortable and fit snuggly in the ear. The shape of the AirPods bothers my earholes. I even purchased some vinyl condoms with earplugs to cover it up. It makes it more comfortable, but its still noticeably more uncomfortable. Also, those vinyl covers don't allow the AirPods to fit in the case, so I have to remove them all the time.... which isn't too bad since I ended having to do that with the SoundPEATS because I couldn't get them to charge properly with the earbud cushion? on.
Look/Style: The AirPods look dumb as hell. The SoundPEATs are small and round and fit right in the ear and don't have a white wang hanging down over your earlobe.
Dropped Connection/Choppy Audio: Ok. Here I was thinking that the AirPods would correct this issue with the SoundPEATs. When I'm oustide working in the yard, audio was choppy regardless if the phone was 10 feet away or in my pocket. Nothing I did seemed to correct it. It was like this with the SoundPEATS. I THOUGHT that the chip in the AirPods would keep this from happening. NOPE. SAME PROBLEM PERSISTED and was made worse by the fact that they were 3.5x more expensive!!!!! Work fine in doors and while I'm at work in the lab. Must be some sort of interference outside. But really, Come on. Its 2019. GET IT TOGETHER.
Exterior Audio: UGH The AirPods fail spectacularly here. Not only do they get choppy while I'm out doing yard work, but because they don't have a rubber tip that seals up the ear canal like the SoundPEATs, that means I get to hear the FULL sound of my lawnmower and weedwacker and it drowns out my jams. And also my nagging boss at work and rando plebians i come across in my travels. Also this means they will be practically useless on an airplane. The SoundPEATs helped block out the engine drone and crying and shouting babies, children, and MAGA douchenozzles.

Overall, I like them enough to keep using them for regular use but I will need to go back to my SoundPeats for airplane travel and yardwork. Son of a....

review title: Buy brand new to save yourself
review_body: I ordered a pair of use AirPods because they come from the Amazon warehouse and should be properly checked before being shipped out. Unfortunately mine never worked as a result of the AirPods inside the case not belonging to the case and being defective. Such a waste of time and money.

These airpods are light, comfortable and generally produced and received well for calls. Overall though, I would not recommend for Android phones (despite what other reviews tell you).

I'd searched ahead of time and plenty of Android-phone users seemed to have good experiences despite this being an Apple product (which obviously works better with other Apple products). I wanted to try them because of the lightweight comfortable fit that many people had raved about, long battery life, as well as the tap functions. I didn't realize how annoying the bugs for Android would be though, even after forcing a firmware update the main issues consistently recur:

1. Slipping out of sync (between left and right, sometimes more and more out of sync, if I don't pause and replay, or unsync and re-pair)

2. Audio cut-outs - usually not if you have uninterrupted line-of-sight, but if my phone is in my pocket or bag, then it was guaranteed to cut out.

Between backorder delay, and delay to return due to trying to troubleshoot the issues with re-pairing and firmware updating, I'm unable to do a return now :(

review title: These are USED AirPods as of Nov 2021
review_body: I received a well-used item, not new.

review title: It is what it is. But
review_body:
It’s exactly what you asked for, Air-pods. Everything is good the noise canceling is trash along with volume compared to any traditional headphones. The battery life is good for being so light and small. The sound quality is affected by the lack of noise cancelation.

Update after a month or 2 owning these. A lot of people say that I sound like I’m far away, or muffled. It happens ALOT. Barely ANY bass, if non at all. Pretty uncomfortable in the ears too over an extended period of time. It is what it is.

I purchased these after having to return the AirPods Pro. I have small ears and I am one of the few people who can't wear the AirPods pro without discomfort and without them falling out of my ears. So, very sadly, I had to return those and "settle" for these. I feel very happy with these. The sound is fine, obviously not as good as the Pro's, and they don't have noise cancellation (which was nice). But Apple has a very solid product here. These DO stay in my ears, and are not uncomfortable. I like how they automatically pair with my Apple devices. Unfortunately, I cannot get them to pair with my work issued laptop. Also, although I did get them to pair with my Dell personal laptop, I cannot adjust the volume no matter what I try, and I'm not the only one with the issue.
I googled it and lots of people are trying to resolve this issue. It will literally deafen me, so I cannot use the with my laptop, which is disappointing. It seems to be a problem with the Dell Inspiron version, and maybe not Apple. Either way, will not work satisfactorily. I do use them with my Apple watch, and i love them for that. Overall, pretty happy!

review title: Prefer to Beats Powerbeats Pro primarily for running
review_body:
I wanted wireless headphones mostly for running, but also to use casually for conference calls and listening to music/podcasts. From the outset I assumed the Powerbeats would be the best for me and got those. While they are very good, it didn't blow me away. It wasn't so much better than the $30 bluetooth headphones I got 3 years ago. I also struggled to get a good fit in my one ear. What made me send it back though, was that it is just too bulky. The carrying case is huge and even the earphones without the case are big, and I didn't just want to put them in my denim pockets, as they have protrusions that might get damaged or break off. Bottom line, you can't just keep them in your pockets "just in case". Every time you want to take it somewhere you have to make space for it somewhere.

So I got the Airpods. I was very skeptical that:
1. They would fall out when running
2. They would not survive the sweat I generate in the Atlanta summer during 13 miles jogs

I watched some YouTube videos testing their water tolerance and I was surprised that people reported them fully functional after a wash/dry cycle (obviously not recommended). I pulled the trigger and bought it and am happy to report that they work perfectly for running. The sounds is good (not quite as great as the Powerbeats), and they don't fall out at all while running. I thought I'd might need an after market silicone casing or ear hook, but found I didn't need it.

The main reason I removed 1 star is because they are very slippery. Even when the Airpods and your hands are dry, it's slippery and prone to falling when taking it out. When the Airpods and your hands are both wet and slippery, they become like a wet piece of soap, almost impossible to handle. Apple should make it a bit more grippy.

Overall, great product and what really sealed the deal is the portability and the fact that I can carry the Airpods on me all the time.

How is it possible that this product gets all the accolades about how great it is with the iPhone? The connectivity is the absolute worst of any bluetooth I've ever owned. I can be in the middle of a conversation and it disconnects, then connects back, then drops my call. This has happened over and over again. When I call Apple, they tell me to do the same remedies and still they do not work. I will be returning these this week and going back to the Plantronics Legend that is far more reliable. DO NOT BUY!

review title: Mic Failure after 9 months of use
review_body:
I bought the Airpods new. they work great for listing to music and phone calls. However, about 9 months in the mic on both airpods have a defect where the caller can barly hear you, or voice recordings using the airpods is very low. Being out of warranty at 9 months the only option is customer paid replacement. After checking the support pages, there are quite a few people reporting the same issue with Airpods. Buying AppleCare for the AirPods at $30 sounds good, but it cost $30 per incident for repair/replacements. In this case it would cost $60 to get two replacement Airpods. $60 for the airpods and $30 for the AppleCare puts it at another $90 for a new pair, when a new pair costs $130. Even though the warrenty is for 3 years, it only covers 2 incidents....and replacing both for the mic issue is 2 incidence. So the 3 year warranty endes at 9 months to get the mic fix...which allows for maybe 2 years of service.

Apple needs a recall program for this issue, because $130-$170 for AirPods what will fail at 9 months is a problem.

review title: They're OK. I wish I bought them elsewhere though.
review_body:
I was hesitant to purchase Airpods because of the steep price so when I saw there was a deal a few months ago (early 2020) I hopped on the bandwagon! Since I have many Apple products, these DO make it easier to sync up to my Macbook, iPhone and iPad. However, even with that being the case the airpods I received were defective. I spent hours talking to customer service and at the Apple Store (pre-COVID) and they ended up having to replace the case and one of the airpods. At times I still have issues with connectivity and the microphone isn't the greatest. Sometimes my airpods would be in the case and I wasn't trying to connect to my phone yet the music would play WHILE THEY WERE IN THE CASE. I even reported this to the apple care team and my customer service representative told me it was something they'd never seen or heard about before. (Seriously wish I was making this up, I just wanted to be able to have wireless earbuds).

I'll admit that I don't fully regret my purchase, but regret buying it via Amazon instead of from the Apple Store or a major retailer (i.e. Best Buy). Not sure if my logic makes sense, but I feel like there would've have been less of a chance of getting a faulty item.

TLR; Airpods aren't a bad investment, but be wary and monitor your item if you buy it via Amazon. ALSO they aren't noise cancelling and the microphone isn't the greatest. The sound is OK but if you want to still spend a good amount of money, you probably can get better quality headphones elsewhere. The best feature to me is that it is super connected with my apple products and I can tap to change the songs, etc.

review title: These will damage your hearing! Don’t buy!
review_body:
Been a musician for 30 years without one issue with my ears. Wore these pieces of crap for two weeks and now I can’t get the ringing out of my ears for over a month now. Went to my doctor to determine that my left ear may now be permanently damaged. I primarily took phone calls for work with these things.
Word of advise, don’t buy these things if you value your hearing. Apple don’t give a crap about you and wouldn’t be the first time some company released a product that harms the public.

Approximately 80 % of time these ear pods chime when placed in ears and the clarity in sound couldn't be better. Unfortunately one never knows when the 20% of nothing will kick in. This week I've had five consecutive evenings when preparing to listen to my book in bed, I discovered no chime nor connection. I called the support phone number and waited too long. I went onto CHAT with quick response and willing person to help, but I couldn't understand her. Thirty minutes later, she decided to put me through to higher authority. I went on hold and met another person I couldn't understand. That person couldn't understand me. I don't want these ear pods. My daughter has the same ones without problems. Mine have problems. I want a refund. It's not offered!

review title: BEWARE! PLEASE READ MORE. Don’t buy Apple products through Amazon
review_body:
It’s a pain to get Apple service if you bought these through Amazon and bumped into problems like I did.
So I purchased these on Prime Day (10/13). As soon as 10/17 the left pod started having problems. It didn’t hold charge even was left overnight. Called Amazon support, was told to contact Apple directly.
Long story short, Apple first suggested to send me replacement for left pod and put a hold on my card of $73.83 for non-return fee (in case I didn’t return the defected AirPod) — reasonable. Then I received the new left pod, Apple didn’t include the return label and just told me to discard the defected pod — which meant I just bought a brand new left pod and WTF!!!
Apple explained that since I didn’t buy these AirPods directly from them, the limited warranty didn’t apply to my purchase. Woaaaa!!!!
Amazon didn’t make AirPods right folks?
After a week of frustration calling Apple to follow up (while using the defected pod, I didn’t wanna break the seal of the new pod unless I knew exactly how this issue gonna land), Apple agreed to reserve the charge on my credit card for the stupid replacement.
Amazon Associate was nice enough to follow up w me about this case. But the contract whatsoever between Amazon and Apple was a mess and their customers were the one who suffered.

I love being able to throw these things in my pocket. I felt they looked a little goofy at first, but I got over that. They don't advertise these ones as noise cancelling, but I swear they do cancel out some of the outside noise, and I don't think that's just in my head, either. They aren't cheap, but I have a pair of these and a pair of Beats Studio Earphones, and that way I can go either way, which usually means I use the AirPods for walks, or going out, and the Earphones are for the beach, or at home (is it just me or is it just a little scary being basically deaf to the world around you at times?)

I think they ought to include these with the purchase of the expensive phones that Apple sells, but that's just me.

One last thing-supposedly the newer generation are more sweat resistant than these ones, but I haven't had any issues there, so I'm not sure what that's all about. It's not like I'm a marathon runner, but I have worn these in the summer on long walks, and besides cleaning them with a q-tip here and there, there's no issues.

The battery life is about 2 hours, maybe a hair less than that, but if you just bring the case with you, you put them back in there and about 15-20 minutes later they're charged again. The case itself needs to be charged every so often, which roughly translates to every 2-3 days, or every 3 charges. They last a long time if they're just sitting in the drawer, not on the charger, which makes them available to use pretty much at all times. As the corny cliche goes, I don't leave home without them.

review title: Not everyone is getting the same version and most people wont know the differance
review_body: I own 2nd generation and bought for my BF as a gift. However when he opened the box and went to charge he looked at me after they were plugged and said... How do I know they are charging? I looked at him like he was crazy. Then I realized they were completely different from mine. 2nd gens DO NOT have silver on the front like the ones we got. Also the charging light was inside. I know they're first gen but IDK if they are first gen knock offs. Box looked iffy. We were returning anyways so no need to look up serial number.

review title: Perfect for those who loved their wired apple earbuds, fit is the same and not for me
review_body: So these would have been perfect, if only they fit my ears. The sound quality is pretty good, they connect so easily, they charge fast and last a while, they even stayed in my ears pretty well, but for me they are painful to wear. This shouldn’t have surprised me because I remember my first pair of apple wired EarPods when they changed the design, those literally made my ears blister and bleed. These fit exactly the same. Many people love that fit, though! If you’ve historically liked the pod design, these will likely be great for you. If you’re hoping for something different, go pro or another brand. I’m gifting to a family member who loves their wired earbuds and I think he’ll love these. I upgraded myself to the pros with the customizable fit, way better for me personally.

review title: its apple, recommend for frequent apple iphone/ macbook user + frequent wireless head phone user
review_body: This is design to work with iphone macbook etc. After all Apple desgin their product to work best with their product. It can work with android phone just like a regular bluetooth device but you will lose those features that are unique to apple. And you will be better off buying those generic bluetooth that is much cheaper. Indeed, I do not feel any sound difference between Airpods 2 and those I bought off street. But, if music quality is something you want + noise cancellation feature, go for airpod pro which now I feel it is more worthy. However, 2 main problem with me is that 1. even though I have iphones and macbook, I don't wear headphones so it's a waste to spend on such expensive gadget 2. my friends who reccoomend this to me about how "they sleep without feelign its in ears" but it doesn't work.... I feel strange wearing them, I can definitely feel I am wearing headphone, and the left ear one keeps falling out of my ear on its own!! I was sitting and watching movies, not even moving at all and it slip out every 60s. So ... I will say ear type matters too... If air pods isn't for you and you really want apple, go for the pro.

I love these Airpods! I like that they're easy to use. If you take one pod out, it automatically pauses the music which is really cool. They automatically connect when you put them in your ear and automatically disconnect when you put them in the case. easy to charge, same charger cord as the iPhone uses. I didn't want to get any earphones with that rubbery material because I feel like that is too difficult to clean and it catches more germs. So I prefer the plastic-y material ear phones. The sound is good quality. For me, it was worth the money. I tried quite a few off-brand, cheaper, wireless earnphones, but they were all crap. Airpods are the real deal

These were ordered October of 2020 for a Christmas gift for my daughter. The right one quit working. Of course apple wasn’t too helpful and I basically sent them back only to have them send them back with the same issue. I will be calling and demanding a replacement pair or a refund. Be ready Apple. A contract works both ways. Service works both ways. You failed on your end of the bargain.

Ok these are my first time having an airpods and I did some research of how telling if you get fake or real. The only way to know they are real once you connect to them and your name pops up when you connect and you see all the setting for the airpods and you see about the airpods. Fake if you don't see the all the setting. So the AirPods 2nd generation are real. I highly recommend buying this.

I had a pair of SENSO Bluetooth headphones and they had served me well and after a couple of years I wanted to go wireless, since the wire between each earpiece was bothersome, but I didn’t want to spend a lot for the gym and was worried about the fit with Apples AirPods. The price drop on the Apple AirPods was too good to pass up and I upgraded. My concern about the fit and them not fitting and possible falling out while exercising and out for a run we’re quickly dismissed. They fit very good, stay in place deliver excellent sound and the battery life is excellent also. The charge quickly and I went with the wired charging since I still use the Apple lightning cord on my phone and would use that charger. These were a great trade up and I am very p,eased with the Apple AirPods. The AirPods themselves offer many features including Siri, and other options but too much to write up, if your interested read the “about this item” notes in Amazon’s page.

I'm cheap. This was in large part why I resisted shelling out the money for these. Consequently, I tried several other Bluetooth earbuds, several on the decidedly cheap end of the scale. One of the problems I experience is finding earbuds that fit my ears. I have very small ear canals, so the earbuds that have the cone shape tip that fits into the ear canal either just won't fit, or are extremely painful after a short time. The only shape I've found that actually works for me are these, which I discovered with the first pair of wired Apple earbuds that came with a new iPhone several versions back.
I included this picture, which shows the Airpods on the left and the much cheaper knock-off I tried. I thought I'd be okay with the shape of the cheap ones, but as you can see, they are actually much larger than the Airpods, so they were frequently falling out of my ears, especially when I was doing any physical activity.
So, I bit the bullet and shelled out for the OGs. Here's my take:
Pros:
-Integration with other Apple products. I have an iPhone, iPad and Apple watch and these work quite seamlessly unlike any others I've tried. I put "almost" in the title because I'm sure it will be improved on in further versions, I'm just not sure how. Oh, and I've never used "Hey Siri" as much as I do with these. I love being able to adjust the volume (among other commands) hands free. True story: Yesterday I was riding a scooter home from work, and not wanting to remove either hand from the handlebars, I wanted to use Siri to increase the volume. There was enough ambient downtown noise that Siri was having trouble hearing me, so as I was tootling down the busy city street I was saying "Hey Siri" repeatedly at increasing volume, until I was shouting it. Not one of my finer moments...
-The fit (see above)
-Quick charging. I will have something to say about the battery life in Cons, but one saving grace is that they charge remarkably fast. I do a lot of work from my computer (like a lot of others during the time of COVID), so I appreciate being able to get a quick charge on them between meetings.
-Sound quality. I am not an audiophile, so my opinion here is very pedestrian, but they seem to have a good dynamic range. I've been blown away by the bass response coming out of such a small thing.
Cons:
-They still are not very secure in my ears. I suppose that could be more my issue than the Airpods, but I did have to buy an aftermarket accessory kit that included the silicone tips with wings and a silicone lanyard. Sometimes I commute to work on an electric scooter, and if it weren't for those (particularly the lanyard) I would have dropped one of them in the street multiple times. Sometimes I walk over a grate in the street and have a brief moment of fear that one will pop out of my ear and through the grate. With my luck, it isn't so much an issue of "if", but "when". (Side Note: if Apple doesn't sell replacements individually, they should)
-Battery life. I figure I get about 2 hours of active use, which is fine and I think what they advertise. The curious thing is that the two discharge at very different rates. I'm trying to keep track so I can take them into our local Apple store and ask about it, but it is odd, and I have seen other reviews that also noted that issue.
Overall, I give them 2 thumbs up!

I picked these up at a slight discount. I've been curious about AirPods for years now. I was always discouraged by the steep price and so for the longest time, i settled for "budget earbuds". My AirPods (second generation) arrived today and I don't typically rush onto Amazon to write a review but these things are spectacular. I love the Siri integration, the customizable double tap feature, the crisp and clear audio when listening to everything from music to podcasts...even the charging case is a sleek looking device. Pairing your Airpods to your iPhone, iPad, or any bluetooth device really, is a total breeze (but most especially when it comes to other iOS devices.

review title: I'm glad I bit the bullet, and purchased the real deal instead of knockoffs.
review_body: I've purchased 3 different knockoffs, and each one was terrible. I "bit the bullet", spent the mega amount of money for the "cadillac" brand, and am satisfied with the generation one airpods. Unlike the knockoffs, these earbuds don't drop connection, and stay synced with one another. If you're like me, and are hesitant because of the amount of money the apple brand cost, you'll get more for your money buying the official brand. I've spent the same amount collectively on the three other "airpods" being $130 instead of buying these in the first place. Now, if we're to look at it like this, in the end I've spent $260 😥 I would include a picture of the airpods, but anyone reading this can just as easily google image search 'apple airpods generation one". What I received is exactly as described.

When i tell you i couldn’t wait for my EarPods to come i couldn’t wait i ordered them Friday and they came next day afternoon they are AMAZING I LOVEEEEE EM. I’m a person that’s big on sound and they sound amazing, They really block out any noises around and if you’re listening to music n you take one pod out the ear it automatically pauses you also can have the option of getting your messages read out loud in the pods. I Love them Great Purchase like everything else i order from Amazon👍🏻

Day 2 of my WFH experience I realized I needed wireless audio capability to be more effective on video and audio teleconferences. With meetings usually lasting one hour, and my schedule often having back-to-back meetings, it would be nice if the battery life were a little longer than the 3 hours. However, understanding that batteries add weight, and current technology is what it is, I'll go with bluetooth airpods any day! Just remember to park them in the recharger module between meetings so you don't have to switch to wired audio. These also work well when you're WFH with a significant other and you both need your own professional space, even if in an apartment.

My little 7 year old nephew wanted the first generation airpod for his birthday but his parents thought they were a waste of money, so I got them for him behind his parents' backs and he loves them.They operated well until approximately a month ago. At that point, the right earbud microphone started to malfunction and would no longer detect sound until he yelled. I phoned Apple customer service and went over all of the possible remedies, such as upgrading to the most recent iOS and checking that the AirPods were running the most recent firmware. When customer service was unable to remedy the issue, they advised me to send the AirPods in for repair. I received a FedEx shipment box and label and made them an offer for repair. The AirPods were returned to me approximately three days later, along with a message from the technicians claiming that there was nothing wrong with them.I then tested them on my phone and my wife's phone, and the right microphone on both phones would only detect sound at a very high volume, but the sound was still garbled. I phoned Apple's customer service department once more. The representative advised that I take the AirPods to the local Apple Store and explain the problem to a professional there. Unfortunately, the nearest Apple Store was an hour away from my house, however the agent did not appear to find this to be an issue.I expressed my unhappiness with having to drive 2 hours round trip to fix a $130 equipment, and I inquired as to why I couldn't send them back for repair while determining the specific problem. The agent agreed to send another shipping box and note that the problem was with the right microphone on the repair ticket. I got another package, sent the AirPods in for repair a second time, and waited. They gave them back to me and said there was nothing wrong with them. And, once again, the right microphone isn't working properly.At this point, I'm left wondering why the "World's Most Valuable Company" would consider it appropriate to force a client to spend 3 hours of my time repairing Apple's product rather than just shipping a new pair and keeping the consumer satisfied. Apple's customer service has tarnished what might have been a fantastic device.

Pros n Cons
Pros
Great battery life ( over 4 and a half hours average).
When pods are almost out if power it gives a decending musical notation ( unlike others that scream BATTERY LOW in your ear while trying to go to sleep).
Battery case gives two full charges before IT needs to recharge.
Fits nicely in ear canal.
Good sound quality.
Cons..( getting picky here)
Programming turns off when removing pod from ear ( ok..that's a plus). But it doesn't resume the program when replacing the pod. You must manually hit the start button again.
Also when listening to a podcast and you wish to switch to another you cannot just push the button on the newly decided upon program. You must shut down the previous show and then pick the new one.
( I told you this was picky...didn't I)
Otherwise a great product that outshines any knockoffs. These are more expensive, but more enjoyable than buying eight cheapo lookalikes and getting frustrated at the inferiority.

Great quality here and well worth it!!

review title: Theres a reason why everyone loves them
review_body:
I ordered these and a pair of Bultone ear buds in the same month. These are one of the best purchases I have ever made in terms of convenience, lifestyle enhancement, and general happiness.

Pros:
1. sound quality - perfect for music - great, even tone and quality bass, reliable never any static or wonky pitches

2. Bluetooth connection - só reliable and easy to connect. Once paired with a device it’s seamless; just pop them in your ears. Can stray a pretty good distance from your device and still have good reception.

3. Call quality & Siri - call quality is awesome and works without the other party even noticing I’m on Bluetooth. Have used them for both business and personal calls in the car and at home for hour long conferences as well as quick hit calls. Never had a problem with people hearing me or hearing the other parties. Really love that Siri announces notifications when I’m using them.

4. Personalization - Love that you can tweak the controls to your own preferences.

Cons
Charging - While charging the ear buds is super fast and easy I will say that the charging case doesn’t seem to hold a charge as long as the Bultone case does. The buds themselves also don’t hold a charge as long as my Bultone buds do.

Fit - I have very small ears and these are comfortable but they fall out occasionally. I am not comfortable wearing them out and about in public after having lost one on several occasions when it just spontaneously popped out of my ear.

Price - would be nice if these were closer to the 99.00 price point. Just feel the 150.00 price range they hover in is a tad high but I would buy them again for sure

review title: Pre-Christmas iPhone air buds function well during the holiday season
review_body: Apple airpods were delivered a little later than the prime usual, but understandably so due to the pre-Christmas rush. They perform well and the sound is good. The only two considerations are that they don’t fit perfectly into my ear canals as each one is a bit differently shaped. Consequently the noise reduction and the sound quality would be better if they fit more snugly. That being said the Wi-Fi works seamlessly and is greatly improved over the directly wired EarPods I initially received with my Apple X plus phone. The other consideration is that they only hold a charge somewhere between four and five hours. So when I was out Christmas shopping all day one day, the audio faded out after four hours in one year and about 4 1/2 and the other. But I was grateful for those hours. So if these air buds remain functional for a year I may invest in the air Bud pros next Christmas.

review title: I wish I'd bought them sooner--Very useful for persons with hearing issues
review_body:
These are COOL! This is truly something I wish I'd purchased months ago.

They are easy to set up, just flip open case and they connect. Not sure how long one charge lasts--haven't used them long term. Seem pretty secure and mostly stay in place, but get a bit uncomfortable after a few hours. (I think they're a bit too big for my ears.) Sound quality is wonderful. I have hearing aids that are supposed to be able to allow me to listen to music and calls on my iPhone, but sound quality is awful, so I never used either feature. The first time I got an incoming call with these in place, I was surprised and pleased by how easy it was to fully understand the call without having to switch to speaker phone.

I plan to try using my phone in meetings as a way of streaming other's voices directly into my ears. I will be really nice to not miss half of what others say, or to get whiplash from turning my head back & forth to look at whomever is speaking as I try to read their lips. I understand that it's possible to put the phone in front of a TV and have it relay the sound directly to the Air Pods. I currently don't need to do that because I can just pair them with the Roku app on my phone, but will try it out when visiting family to see if it will allow me to hear the TV better.

They are exactly what I wanted/needed. I Really like the version 2 AirPods as a replacement for my first ones. (Didn’t want the newer ones with the pads that stick more into your ears... my ears would not be happy. Luckily I don’t have a problem with the original designed airpods falling out of my ears). NOTE: Batteries lasts longer, sound is good, has hands free hey seri, and still uses the lightning port to charge like all my other apple devices. I use them with either iPhone X Max Pro or Apple watch 4. I don’t use them to listen to music. I usually wear one in my left ear only to take:make phone calls, get notifications & directions, ask seri questions or give commands/get directions etc. . If the battery starts running low I put the right airpod in while the left one is charging. Saved me $$$ also... as using airpods prevents me from getting a traffic ticket as we can’t get caught using or looking at a phone while driving (even while stopped at a stoplight !!!).

review title: Best Bluetooth option for Apple devices, that I’ve found.
review_body:
Pros: they fit comfortably in my ear, the sound is clear and not muffled, and they sync instantly/ with my iPhone AND STAY CONNECTED AS LONG AS IT’S IN MY EAR!! That is HUGE for me, and why I was willing to spend so much on these, considering how irritated I was with my old Bluetooth headset that kept disconnecting from my phone. I also LOVE the magnetic case they come in: it’s the perfect size to fit in my pocket or purse, taking up very little space but big enough that I haven’t managed to lose it yet... 🤣 the ear pieces are magnetically drawn into the case so they fit right every time, no chance for them to accidentally fall out or fail to charge, and the lid is magnetically closed, protecting the ear pieces. I also like that the charge for the case AND both ear pieces ALL show on my phone’s screen when it syncs, so I know when the case needs charging, as well. Last but not least, I like that I can wear one ear piece at a time, so I can swap sides as comfort/charge level dictates.

Cons: they are made from a very hard material, as expected based on stock photos, which makes these uncomfortable for me to wear long term. This is mitigated by the fact that I only need to wear one at a time, as mentioned previously, so I can swap back and forth between sides, as I need to.

I bought these because I do a lot of off-the-floor shifts at my work, which means I can listen to my music while I work. I figured these would be much more convenient for this, so I caved and bought the airpods. And I gotta say, even though I personally do not care much for Apple, these things are fantastic. The sound quality is nearly perfect, great bass capabilities too, and they are honestly almost as good as the headset I use for my computer (Which is a corsair).

My only gripe is with the battery life on them. They die pretty quickly. They didn't last a 5.5-hour shift on at my work from a full charge when I started. Granted, they charge very quickly with the case. Mine went from about 8% to 98% in 23 minutes (I did time the charge). They also appear to just drain even when not in use, not at a fast pace but still. So you'd have to keep them in the charging case when not in use and the case also needs to be charged as well, not that I wasn't expecting this side effect. Aside from this small inconvenience, I have not had any issues with these and I'm very impressed with the quality.

They also fit as expected, don't fall out super easily, and are able to be used for phone calls better than the default mic my phone has.

I must applaud Apple for this one, they did a great job. I highly recommend them and I have no doubt Apple will take advantage of the success and keep developing and improving them.

I’m very impressed. The sound quality is actually extremely good with these 2nd Generation AirPods. They also fit really well in my ears. THEY ARE EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE. You don’t even really feel them in your ears, and they don’t fall out either. I’ve heard that for some people the 3rd Gen AirPods are too big for their ears, but not these. They are a perfect size really, and they deliver excellent sound.

I bought the pro version three months ago and accidentally tossed them (I was drying them with tissues) so I went for the cheapest replacement (Airpods 2). Here are my thoughts as to which one to choose.

If this is the only listening device you have and you care about music quality, then buy Airpods Pro (noticeably superior music quality that falls far below earphones such as Sennheiser HD599; the quality is also below that of Boss QC35II).

If you use this to listen to audiobooks, or if you have better earphones for music at home, by all means go for the regular Airpods. Why? I personally find it far more comfortable. The regular airpods are like the earbuds that come with Iphones -- while not the most comfortable, wearing them for two hours is not a big problem. I found the pro version extremely uncomfortable for more than an hour. The noise cancellation is cool, very cool, but not essential for my usage.

If you travel frequently on domestic/short flights, then airpods pro might be great for its noise cancellation feature. But bear in mind Pro airpods are not the most comfortable. Moreover, battery lasts about 5 hours so airpods won't be ideal for longhaul flights.

What I like about both: if you have lots of Apple devices, switching across these devices is very easy (2-3 clicks/taps).

So for this regular version, I rate:
3/5 for music quality;
4/5 for comfort;
0 for noise cancellation.

If you’re looking for real ones please don’t get these ones. They are fakes !!!
I’m returning then and getting it from Apple

Stopped working after only 9 months!!! I bought these less than 1 year ago and up until 2 months ago they worked just fine. The sound quality for listening to music is very unimpressive but I bought them to use for work while on virtual conference calls. 2 months ago the left earbud stopped picking up my voice on calls or recognizing any other voice commands. I tried several trouble shooting efforts to fix/reset but nothing worked. I could still hear music in it but could not use it on calls. So I started taking calls with just the right earbud. Two weeks ago this earbud too only picked up my voice intermittently. Finally today it stopped working too!!! I now have an expensive pair of earbuds that cant be used on phone calls or recognize any voice commands, which is why I bought them in the first place. I am very disappointed in the crappy quality. Apple lost a loyal customer on this one.

i bought this because i wanted to try a true wireless earphones for the first time. i wanted to avoid it at first since everybody seems to have it, but it is undeniable that it is one of the best in the market right now so i bought it. its pretty amazing. the sound quality is pretty good. it has a total of 10 hours battery life with the charging case. you can do touch commands on it and ask siri questions if youre connected to wifi or data. its slick and easy to charge and use. you can set up the touch commands in the iphone. you can check the battery life if you open the case near to the iphone. it can be connected with android but it does lose some of its function like siri. JUST DONT LOSE AN EARPHONE BECAUSE ITS EXPENSIVE LIKE CRAZY. TO BE SPECIFIC ITS 75 DOLLARS OR SO DEPENDING ON THE TAX.

review title: Meh, you can find better for less.
review_body: I’ve tried a variety of earbuds, I finally broke down and bought the AirPods BUT I don’t feel like they are worth it. I mean they’re fine, but they don’t work well for running... they don’t fall out but moisture (sweat) causes them to to disconnect because their sensors malfunction, I don’t know if that’s just me and it’s not like my ears are actually sweating inside it’s just sweat coming from my head. They don’t have the functions that other earbuds have (like tap for next/pause/volume) and the stress of worrying about losing them is overwhelming! They’re perfectly fine for walking and sitting and I often find that I forget I have them in because they’re relatively comfortable. But it’s easy to knock them out and if you lay down they can shift and “disconnect” again because the sensors aren’t touching your ear on both sides of the earbud. If you think you can use these earbuds and wear earmuffs at the same time (ear protection for loud machinery) think again! The lightest touch can knock one out then your audio stops and you’re left with an earbud in the earmuff. The noise cancellation is fine, I’m a female who generally only has one in at a time for safety reasons, and the sound is fine. I’ve had better sound from cheaper earbuds. Im sure all of these things are unique to the user, maybe my ears are weirdly shaped, maybe I sweat more than most people. It just doesn’t feel like they’re worth the money. On a positive note, they’re great for phone calls.

I've always wanted AirPods but found the cost too expensive. I was really happy when I found these AirPods for cheaper and I found the double tap feature really convenient when I'm on the go. Unfortunately, I've experienced multiple issues with them.

I often find the notification that my AirPods are connected when they're in the case and the case is closed. I thought it was because I was using an older phone, but I just got the new iPhone 13 and the issues persist. It's pretty annoying to have the notification because while it's at the top of my screen, I can't swipe down to access the notification bar, and it takes a while to go away. There was a time when I was playing music through the speaker and the music stopped because my phone said my AirPods had connected.

I've also had issues with the double tap feature. There are times when my music pauses by itself and though my hair sometimes brushes against, I just don't think it can mimic a double tap. There are also times when the headphones won't respond to a double tap.

Lastly, they die so quickly! I don't know if this is normal for all AirPods but it feels like I'm constantly having to charge them, whereas my other Bluetooth headphones can run for days on a single charge. I'm pretty bummed that these didn't work out.

review title: Great purchase for those who use phone or listen alot
review_body:
Love these. Took me a few years to finally purchase because of the cost, but would 100% recommend buying if you are on the fence. They are super easy to use, very lightweight and they work great! They connect to my phone without problems 99% of the time and the sound quality is perfect. They are far superior to any other headphones I have used and will never use anything else.

After having them for a good 6 months now, there are rare times where they have issues connecting. Its not a major complaint and it never stays that way, just occasionally they just wont connect. I usually just place them back in the case and the next time they work fine.

I have been using the airpods for about a month now, and I am a first time Apple product user

I have purchased less expensive airpods/earbuds and these are the best by far

Shipping was fast, and packaging was in tact

Connectivity: I have an android phone, and connecting the airpods to my nonapple product was super easy

Sound: When making and receiving phone calls, the sound quality was good. Way better than the other 3 earbud brands I own. There was no choppiness, no computerized sound and the other party/myself did not sound like we were at a distance. Music and video sound was crisp

Distance: I live in an apartment. So I was able to leave my cell phone in room A, and go to rooms B and C without losing connection. I also was able to go outside without losing connection

Battery life: Kind of short. If you're on a 5+ hour road trip or flight, you'll have to recharge your pods. Overall, 5 hours is not bad

Fit: They don't fall out of my ears. Also, It's more comfortable to use headphones for extended amounts of time. Only because there is no cushion on the airpods

The charging dock for the airpods is small and compact. I usually keep it connected to my laptop to keep it charged

Overall the apple airpods are worth the price, and I do recommend this product

I’ve owned these for a month and debated returning them a few times. 1.) I’m pretty sure the pair I received was not “new” even though they appeared to be. It seemed like someone may have tried them, returned them and they were repackaged to appear new. I thought I might be being paranoid having received multiple used items across Amazon at this point, so I cleaned them and decided to keep. 2.) I am currently waiting on a replacement for the left pod less than a month in. It had a defective battery right out of the box. I’m not sure if that’s Apple’s fault or if someone else got them and returned for the same reason. Either way Apple is replacing it free of charge since it dies within 30 minutes on a full charge (so at least they’re real).I like the AirPods but I’m not sure I trust Amazon with these purchases anymore. I probably wouldn’t buy them on Amazon again.

I have the first gen. AirPods for several years before I lost one to a dog incident and the other to a washing machine. LOVED THEM but didn't have the money to invest in a new pair at the time. Tried a few knockoff brands for $20-$30 and had decent success but when I started travelling weekly for work, it was time to up the game again. Bought the new generation model and have been wildly disappointed ever since. Static regularly, battery life in average, on Zoom meetings they start going haywire at about the 40 minute mark and they only intermittently connect to my Microsoft Surface (which the knockoff brands had no problem doing). Maybe I just got a bunk pair of these but if I could go back to the originals I would. If I could also get my $200 back, I'd do that too. Sometimes newer isn't better.

I use these at least daily (mainly for my morning walks) and so far, so good! The sound is decent and I enjoy the “touch” technology that is built in. I have my right ear set to next song and my left to Siri which allows for an almost completely hands free experience once I get my playlist selected. These are a replacement to the first generation ones, which sadly went missing on a trip. I do feel that the first generation ones fit in my ears a bit better, but these still fit, just not as seemlessly. They are not noise canceling, but I need to be somewhat aware of my surroundings when walking so that’s fine with me! I did try a family member’s airpod pros and honestly, the fit was awful, so for me, especially with the Black Friday deal I got, these were the best option.

review title: How did I live without these?
review_body:
I have had other ear buds from all kinds of companies, I wish I could afford a Bose, but I can’t. My brother said I should try them, so On prime day I splurged. This was the first time that I listened to music and I could hear the small nuances of instruments in the background. Some of them I never knew were there, or talking at the end of the song, and it was clear.
I can hear people very well and they tell me they can hear me very well also. And I am slightly hard of hearing, so being on the phone with the earbuds is the best thing ever.
If you ever want to know how great these earbuds are, and it might not be your thing, but put on a Depeche Mode song. You’ll be astonished at what you can hear. If you don’t have a pair of these you’re really should- Worth every penny.

A FEW DAYS AFTER MY REVIEW...CHANGE THE 5 STAR TO 4: It’s stilly excellent. My friends can hear me very well and I, them. Their complain is there hearing a lot of background noise and apparently, I can do nothing to stop that. I thought I’d use them for conversation in store, but now, I hesitate to do so, because friends would be side tracked with all the sound around me. Still the best I could find and the best that is recommended by my friends. FIRST REVIEW WAS 5 start—as follows: Silly thought, right? Everything about these ear buds is what I hoped.....quality. How hard It is, purchasing anything these days and being anxious about the quality or lack there of, no matter what you pay for the product. (If this is confusing to you, please read the novel Atlas Shrugged by Ayn Rand.) The ear specific fit, sound quality, apperance.....all are wonderful. Ease of connecting to any of my devices....WONDERFUL. I cannot rate construction longevity nor battery life, because I have only had them for a few days, and before that, I had the plug in buds that I rarely used, because I kept sitting the phone down to use my hands in the kitchen, and dragging my phone off Of a surface by moving around. Trying to hear friends on their speakers, because they are busy, too became frustrating. This WAS the perfect answer. They hear me better and finally, I can hear them even when they turn their back to their phone. You will hear from me if they break down anytime soon.....promise. Since my iphone is the new SE2020, trouble shooting, if any problem arrises, will definitely be a breeze. I am so enjoying these airbuds. Voice activation helped type this review.

My AirPods keep disconnecting. Sometimes only the left AirPod works - have to reset and reconnect. Just yesterday, even after charging the AirPods for few hours, the right AirPod stays at 0%. Have a reset and charge again. It has been a hassle so far. I don’t have an Apple store near me, the closest one is 200 miles, so I have no option other than using it by resetting it every time. Not sure if this is an authentic product that I received. I am out of return period, so nothing can be done, unfortunately.

In order to determine whether or not these AirPods were real, I immediately checked to see if the serial number matched Apple's official website. The number couldn't be verified. After opening the box, I noticed two things: "the Designed by Apple in California" was black, not grey, and inside the case were small black particles. Not only was it until I visited helpful websites that explain how to spot fake AirPods that I knew these were fake. Please don't be fooled by the packaging!

Of course, this does not mean that all airpods from Amazon are fake. A friend of mine purchased them from here last year and hers was verifiable. So, I think it's a case-by-case situation. Make sure to do some research once you receive the package!

Overall, I was looking so forward to finally purchasing my first Airpods, but the end result was very dismaying and disappointing. Although it would cost more, to play it safe, I would recommend purchasing from the official website!

I have been a gym workout Rat for many years. I presently workout at my gym 3 daws a week, 2hours each. I find workouts good, tough and can be boring. My gym played music at one time, but then it was discontinued. I purchased a Sandisk, Sansa Clip with 2 memory cards and used it for years until it no longer worked. Then I started noticing these people with white stems hanging out their ears, looked funny. When I checked into these, I found that they were air and ear pods. One of my friends let me try his Apple AirPods. I was very impressed until I heard the price. As a result over the next couple of months, I purchased two other brands at $45.00 each. Both had technical issues, so I finally returned them and purchased the more expensive Apple AirPods, 2nd generation and since then, I have never looked back. Easy setup, easy music selection and easy streaming. So now I am one of the gym rats that walks around with White things hanging out his ears. Great decision.

review title: Nope. Just setting yourself up for disappointment.
review_body:
I love how comfortable these are. The sound quality is good and the Bluetooth range is impressive. The battery life is fine. Nothing incredible, but it will get you through 3-4 days before you have to charge the case again. However, they DO NOT last! I bought a pair of the original AirPods and they lasted about a year before the microphone went out on the left ear. 3 months later the microphone on the right AirPod went out.
Because I have small ears I have a hard time finding earbuds that work so I caved and bought a gen 2 about 6 months ago.
Guess what happened?! Yep. The left microphone went out. I fully anticipate the right one will go anytime now.
So even though these are comfortable and have great sound quality I do not recommend. If I’m spending more than $100 for earbuds they should work for more than 6-12 months.
I’m on the hunt again and I’ll find something that lasts more than a minute. Or something cheap enough that it won’t hurt my feelings to have to replace every 6 months.

review title: Don't waste your money on these, and don't buy from this seller
review_body:
What an absolute waste of money.

I got these airbuds because of their shape--it's about the only shape that fits in my ear and stays. I was also excited about the functionality of the earbuds. However, the earbuds were never fully functional. I was never able to get the earbuds to switch through songs, for example. They did pause and play whatever I was listening to, but they most often did this when I would accidentally touch the earbuds. Or my hair grazed the earbuds. So, really they were not very functional at all anyway. But I could use them to listen to music, and I'm really not super picky, so I just kept using them.

About two months in, one of the earbuds fell onto a hardwood floor and broke open. I was able to kind of stick it back together, but it never worked after that. Within days, the magnetic metal bottom of both earbuds fell off..

At this point I contacted the seller and told them the issues. They said they would send a new pair. I waited weeks. Still waiting, months after my purchase, for any kind of communication. I had to escalate my complaints through amazon, but the best they could do was refund half of the price.

DON'T BUY THESE.
And if you really want to, at least don't buy these from this seller.

I bought these mainly for calls. The sound quality is great and they’re very convenient. I might wear them a could hours in a row for calls and not even notice. The charge lasts for hours.

I wear them to listen to music while flying as well. They’re not noise canceling but suit my purposes just fine. I don't hear normal cabin noises while wearing them.

However, they don’t stay in my ears as well as some people report. I couldn’t use these while being active for instance. I’ve already chased one that fell out and rolled down a plane aisle.

I was on the fence for quite awhile about whether I needed these as I own everything Apple, but I held back and that was a mistake! Apple quality SHINES once again! Everything about these is exactly as you would expect from Apple, you really do get what you pay for! I am very pleased with the airpods, I am enjoying them as I write this review, the sound is absolutely excellent! I had zero issues setting them up with my Iphone. The quality in craftsmanship and quality is pure Apple, The sound is amazingly excellent! They are comfortable to wear. I have not tried any heavy duty physical activity with them on but I'm sure there are other reviews here that cover that. I waited too long! The price is reasonable for something that will give you many years of pleasure!

review title: Can't believe I waited to buy!!
review_body:
My original bluetooth, over the ear, hands-free device was starting to drop calls after having it for five years. I was in the hunt for a new device and was debating on whether to purchase these. I absolutely LOVE THEM!

I was afraid that they would not stay in my ears, especially as I love to hike and do yoga. I have had no issues with them staying in, even in upside down yoga positions. They are very comfortable and the sound is amazing. The battery life is extensive and if I need to charge the pods, I just pop then in the charger for 3 minutes and an able to get more life.

There are only two negatives, in my opinion. One, I cannot connect to more than one device at a time like I did with old bluetooth device. This is a pain for me as I have a personal and work cell phone, so I have to make a choice to which device I will connect to. Two, when I receive a call, I have to physically look at my phone or Apple watch to see who is calling and physically answer it. My old bluetooth device would tell me who was calling and I could respond by saying "answer" or "ignore." Even though these are big negatives for me, they are 100% worth every penny. They were cheaper on Amazon than the Apple store and I did not have to leave my house to get them.
