review_body: I bought these for my GF for Christmas and she is in love. Before this, she hadn't had any wireless bluetooth earbuds before, so this review is coming from a "non audiophile" and first time user for headphones like this. it paired to her iPhone instantly and she says the fit is very comfortable. She often wears them for hours listening to audio books. There ins't much in the noise cancelation catagorey, but that's expected with "buds". The fact that you can pause the music with gestures and also by taking one ear bud out blew us away. Would recommend this product or any Apple user looking for a great pair of buds.

Very good quality. I didn't think i wanted these silly things at all but boy. Do they come in handy and sound pretty darn good in my opinion.
I would absolutely buy these if you are even questioning it in any way.
The reason i gave one star is because it said it was the latest model when in fact these are the first edition ones. I personally like these fine and don't care about the wireless charging but if that is important to you this is fooling you. They are NOT the latest model.
Personally i think this is a better deal. I just don't like to be fooled by a seller.

review title: Work great until microphone fails - common problem
review_body: These worked great and fit well until 18 months after purchase the first few seconds of speaking would not be heard by anyone while using the airpods. Upon a search for the problem was the right microphone that failed. Settings allow airpods to automatically pick one of the pods to transmit, or dedicate left or right. Switching between the two showed the right had failed. The system allows to dedicate one side use of the microphone, so changing to the left has temporarily fixed the issue. But the Jabra headphones i also have are 2x as old and no issues like this. Speakers and sound are working great. Connectivity has no issues. Fit is good.

review title: AirPod 2 pods, Non-wireless Charger. Still an awesome product!
review_body:
I’d like to mention some things to clear up confusion for some.
The pods are AirPods 2 models with models A2032/2031 imprinted on the underside of each pod respectfully. Also when saying “Hey Siri,” the pods will wait for next response vs. the AirPods 1 where you’d have to set a double tap action to activate it.
The charging case on the other hand is the regular lightning charging case without wireless charging as there is no light in the front to indicate wireless charging. This is indicated on the product details as it should and is correct. I personally do not thing the wireless charger is worth it unless you already have a wireless charging pad laying around so the regular will do.
Overall, sound quality is great and clear.
Battery lasts fairly long and are worth getting if you can get them for a cheaper price.
I got these for my girlfriend and she loves them. You will definitely see me in the AirPods Pro once my original AirPods die and they became cheaper.
I suggest getting some in-ear rubber hooks if they seem fairly slippery as they can improve the quality with some added bass. Not drastic but good enough, noticeable difference, and they won’t slip and fall out when you’re working out. :)

review title: the only style that fit my tiny ears
review_body: These stay in. They sound good. FINALLY I found a pair that work! I tried several brands of ear pods for under $50 as I didn't want to spend so much on something that I felt is easily lost. Every other pair fell out and frankly I don't want 100% noise cancellation when I'm out in public because I just don't feel it's safe not to be aware of your surroundings. I am SO glad I took the plunge and splurged on these. They pair easily. They are comfortable (4/5 rating). They are easy to store safely on my Apple watch attachment. Sound quality suits me just find. I'm using them for my skype meetings at work with no problems. And they do not fall out!

I've always wanted to own a pair of airpods. So I opted in ordering from amazon considering they're cheaper. I'm also an Samsung user so I wasnt sure if they would work,but I'm here to tell you they did. They pair easily and have excellent sound quality. The only thing I would say is you do lose out on some of the controls such as "Hey Siri". After reading the reviews and questions I heard some say that they're fake. Which is absolutely not true. They are the real deal. They came in a apple box with all the instructions and even have the model number and sign on the back that says "Designed by Apple". If you are considering buying these I definitely recommend, but keep in mind these are the series 1 airpods. Overall they are a better price than buying from apple and offer the same quality.

I was scared getting these because I thought they were going to be fake but they are not fake. So happy that I got them for a good deal instead of going to somewhere else to get them for a lot more. Ok overall, they’re not fake they’re real and quality is good the batteries for the earbuds and the case was 79% and 76% which was pretty. I’m so excited these are my first pair and I am looking forward to see how well they work

I usually don't write reviews, so when I take the time to do so, it is because the product is very good. I love these earphones! I use them primarily when my husband and I are on trips in the car. He listens to his own phone and I use the headphones to listen to mine. The AirPods block out virtually all outside noise. The sound is amazing and, although I haven't actually checked the battery life, the headphones last for what seems like a very long time. I would recommend the purchase without hesitation.

They are okay wireless headphones, when they work. Every other day, I lose connectivity and have to restart my phone or go through a long process to reconnect. It is very frustrating when you are on the move.

I only purchased these because my LG wireless headset finally broke after 4 years. I was going to purchase another one, but the cost difference was about the same. After using the AirPods after a week, I much rather prefer my LG Tone headset. Better quality and functionality.

There some features I like, such as Siri, and immediately pausing sound, but that doesn’t make up for the flaws. Lose one piece, have to buy the whole kit. It can be a chore to keep track of these things, taking them off when not in use and you are moving around.

Get this if you want an Apple fashion accessory. Otherwise there are better products out there.

review title: quit working efficiently after 8 months/don't waste your money
review_body: My purchase was Aug 2020. About 3 months ago, they started not producing sound out of both pods... then they worked for awhile. Now, I have been only getting sound out of one pod and then the next time I use them, it might be the other side. This has been going on for about 3 months. Yesterday the connection was horrible, staticy and i switched to regular wire earbuds. I purchased a knock of these for $29.95 several years ago and they lasted just about as long as this $129 set. I would NOT purchase Apple brand again for lack of how long they have lasted. VERY disappointed.

I had a hard time imagining how these could be better than other Bluetooth headphones I’d tried but they are. The noise cancelling isn’t great but it’s enough that I don’t need to blast the volume. I use these constantly around the house, at work, running errands. The sound quality is pretty good. I regularly use them for zoom and conference calls. They paired seamlessly with my iPhone and iPad. Highly recommend!!

The sound quality is wonderful. The low tones are deep and rich and the higher frequencies are not screechy. I gave 3 stars for noise cancelation cos I can still hear and understand a nearby conversation but with my Sony headphones I can tell someone is talking but I can’t follow what they’re saying. The battery life is great. I went in an 8 hour road trip and watched 6 Netflix shows without needing to recharge them. The fit is not great. The left earbud is significantly smaller than the other and I had to purchase silicone covers to keep it from falling out while doing simple activities.

review title: Great product, watch out for your stuff when delivered!
review_body:
Easy to use! I just opened them and they automatically connected to my iPhone, i bought this to workout listening to jams and the sweat doesn’t make them come off or move out of place.

One small note on delivery
The prime guy took the picture of my package outside my door but kept the box to continue delivering to another doors and then he saw me arrived and he told me that he forgot to leave the box And handed it to me then. I don’t know that was kinda suspicious. Was he gonna keep my AirPods???

review title: Buy these off prime and NOT third party!
review_body: Love my new iPods!! The sound is good, there’s no noise canceling to them but still does it’s job well. I had before bought the JBL wireless pods due to the great price, which I still have, the only issue I had with those was that the pods would fall out easily out of my ears and almost had a clogging sensation when I put them in, rather when I put my ipods in, they fit perfectly and won’t move much at all and stayed in place. (I have small ears) Also, I read a lot of these reviews on these saying these iPods are fake or dirty or whatever and I got legit iPods in the box, plastic cover and all, so they are real! Those people saying they are fake or defective probably got them from a 3rd party seller so my suggestion is to buy them off amazon prime itself and not third parties. Overall I’m super happy about my purchase!!

review title: Sound great, but stop working repeatedly!
review_body: Love the sound quality! I’ve messed around with other headphones for a long time, they all distort voices. I really just use them for talking on the phone. I also really like the charging case. Unfortunately, with first pair I was sent, the left one stopped working in a few weeks. I reset it, it happened again a while later. Then the right one went out, so I returned and repurchased (with AppleCare extended warranty). But the left earbud on the new pair went out within a few days! I reset these, will wait and see if it holds. There should not be this much of an issue with new earbuds. Glad I have the extended return window!

review title: Love these so far. Use them everyday at work
review_body:
So far like these a lot. Use them every day at work when listening to music for a 4 hours. Then lunch with them charging and then another 4 hours of listening while working. Charge time is about accurate. 15 minutes or less charge time. I did have one instance when I thought my right one was dying quick. But after one day it ran out of battery completely and I charged it right away, it was normal.
One thing I would say, I can’t tell the difference between noise canceling but that might be just my ears. Other than that, you get a nice case for it or silicon cover like my Hello Kitty one. Now you have a personalized one for yourself. Love the product so far.

review title: Overpriced but works well and you’re in the club
review_body:
This is a good product if a little overhyped. Comfort is good but not great. The sound is good but not great. The noise cancellation is very good. Used for the phone I usually only put one ear in and I’m told it sounds great and I can hear good.
The only things - my trucker headset I can say answer phone and it does. This doesn’t, so I have to actually answer my phone and it will often switch out of airbud mode and go to phone for phone calls. I’m looking for hands free and this kinda fails on that one. And lastly, way overpriced.

My friend who I talk to on the phone every day tried a bunch of cheaper brands and we would always have trouble hearing each other or they would break. Then she got these and we both noticed a big difference. So I got some for myself and am very happy with them. They are worth the extra money. Sound quality is great. It is easy to have a conversation in the car or while walking or doing other things. Get the rubber cushion thingies too, or the newer version that has them built in, or you might have trouble with them falling out. I never leave them in more than an hour and the battery lasts at least that long.

review title: Skeptical at first, they're the best!
review_body:
Truthfully, I waited a very long time to buy AirPods. I was concerned with their battery life, their ability to fall out of my ears, and especially their price. When I purchased the headphone jack-less iPhone 8 though, I knew it was time to switch.

I love them! Their battery life is very impressive and you can charge just the case which is super cool. I didn't think the increased range of mobility would be that big of a deal, but it is so convenient to be able to have a greater range of motion while running. I can even cook and clean very easily all with music and not worrying about being attached to a phone. After trying them, they do feel pretty secure in my ears. Also, the sound quality is immaculate compared to my previous 20 dollar corded headphones. I'm going to college next year so I'm super excited ill be able to have complete focus even if others are making noise. My music is so clear!

For all my skeptics out there, if you can afford them of course, they are a great purchase! I recommend.

I purchased these for when I am working. When I take them out of the case, they'll both say they are at 100%. I will use them and about half an hour into use, the right airpod will have no battery life left, while the other one will be down to about 75%-71% battery life. I didn't do anything out of the norm with them to drain the battery. If this is the way all of them are, I would not recommend getting these to anyone. I wouldn't want anyone to have to go through what I am having to deal with with my own.

The battery doesn’t last long and doesn’t give you much warning before it dies. I don’t know where to see the battery life other then to ask Siri. Also can’t be connected to multiple devices at once, not to my knowledge at least. I had a set (with wire) for $10 from Walmart that did and it was really nice during working hours.

However these are super convenient, no wires to get tangled. When you remove an ear bud it automatically pauses for you... This is its redeeming feature

This is my second pair of airpods. The first pair I bought new on eBay and thought I was getting genuine Apple ones but they turned out to be fake and are of awful quality. I've been supremely pleased with the ones I got from Amazon. They connect to my phone the instant I pop them into my ear and stop playing the second I take one out which is a super feature when a family member talks to me. No fumbling with the volume button on my phone! The fit into my ear isn't great and I'm going to look into something that will help that out, but overall, I'm very satisfied and definitely recommend this product!

review title: Good product and worth the money - but there is better out there.
review_body:
Android user here - Galaxy S9
Complaint 1- is at the gym with a high concentrated amount of other Airpod users roaming about, that it seems to suffer from interference of some sort. Anywhere else where there might only be a few people also wearing airpods, it seems to be fine. But if you get too many in one place, I've noticed it skips, or seems to get interrupted by something. It's not the internet speed, or cell signal, I've gone earlier when less people, no problems.
This might have something to do with Apple product on an Android device - As a coworker who visits the same gym, has no problem and he runs apple tech / phone.

Complaint 2 - Being on android - you can't see remaining life on your airpods - So you have to just guess when you need to charge it. Not a big deal.. But is slightly annoying to not know whether or not you can go without charging. On apple devices you can easily see battery life remaining for it. - Confirmed by friend who has apple.

Other then that - It's a surprisingly good. As a Non apple fanboy, it's good. Stays in your ear even while running, jogging or doing most gym exercises. Just.. $150 is a bit pricey for my liking.. but I'm getting good use out of them, so was an alright purchase in my books.

review title: Quality unit at a great price
review_body:
A great price on this unit was the main reason for getting the AirPods. Apple's reputation for quality products was another reason.

The sound is terrific and the units charge quickly in the case. The case itself also holds a charge well and re-energizes fast.

Unlike some units, these rely on the Iphone or IPad to adjust the sound level rather than using a tap or touch to do that. That really isn't a negative unless a user is more familiar with that method. Great buy!

review title: Left headphone stopped working in under 10 uses
review_body:
I actually really like airpods but this is totally unacceptable quality control. It seems every time I go to use them I have to re-pair them with my phone because the left airpod is not working for whatever reason. Today upon trying to fix them I am now receiving a red exclamation mark, even after re-pairing and re-setting several times and checking the bottom of the pod and the case for debris or damage.

I didn't pay $200 for headphones that are going to quit working after 10 uses. No one would pay $20/use no matter how much they like the experience when it actually works.

They were brand new and a lot cheaper than Apple was selling them for (I bought them on sale). I use them most days. These are my second pair of AirPods. They only last about 18 months or so before they don't hold a charge long enough to be useable. The updates with Big Sur and iOS 14 made them even better since they automatically switch devices depending on where sound is playing. Sadly, this isn't perfect and the AirPods will favor my iPhone over my MacBook Air and they will automatically connect to my phone first when I have something playing on my computer.

review title: Exactly what you’d get at the apple store
review_body:
First thing, I just got these in today. Second thing, don’t listen to the dum dums giving these a bad review. These are exactly what they say in the description. They are not the wireless charging case and aren’t a lower quality case. It’s the same thing you’d get at the apple store. If you’re dissatisfied with not having the wireless capabilities, spend the extra $60 and stop regretting it on here.
Sound is crazy good, they block 95% of outside noise. Also, I wasn’t expecting this one, but you can fast forward through songs, pause the music and even change the song by tapping either EarPod. Oh, In case you were wondering, they’re new. Not tamepered with, or the wrong kind. Some of these reviews just wanted free stuff.

review title: Love them, wish the battery life on actual airpods were longer
review_body: I love them, never been fond of Bluetooth ear pieces because they were too big but these are perfect. The battery life is pretty decent. I try to only use one ear at a time because they can block out sound, your ears will hurt if you wear them too long, and of one battery goes low I can switch to the other ear. The AirPod charging case battery lasts pretty long it’s the airpods that lose charge quick depending on how much you use them. If you’re a heavy user I suggest putting them in charging case everyday and putting charger case on its lightning cord. if not you can get away with charging them in the case without the lightening cord and only need to put the case on its lightening cord every so often.

At first I really liked them. They stay in my ears and didn't hurt that much, and the battery life seemed to last for a long time. I've had them for about 6 months now though and they have stopped working the way they are supposed to. When I want to use them I have to fiddle with them a lot to get them to work and most of the time only one ear bud is charged. They don't pop up on my phone when I'm trying to see how charged they are and when they are charging only one of them is charging at a time. I don't know what to do because it seems like a total waste of money to buy Airpods for $130 for them to only last 6 months. Now I'm looking into buying new wireless earbuds but I'm definitely not going to be buy Airpods again. :(

review title: Best Air Pods/ ear pods available in the market place!
review_body: Pairing is 100% painless. They stop the audio when you take them out of your ear. Saying Hey Siri if you want volume or song adjustments makes them hands free. The sound is acoustically perfect. At first the price was scary. Now that I have them, I would have paid more. They fit my ears perfectly. It’s too bad the star rating only goes to five.

Purchased for granddaughter 16th birthday. Got the warranty coverage. She never took them off Loved them till she list them at school. She pinged them as explained online and goes where they are supposed to be but not there. She was devastated to know extended warranty didn’t cover lost/stolen. At the cost—can’t replace her loss. Sad!!

In ear headphones are tough for me - they are either uncomfortable or fall out. These are not either! I can wear them for hours and they stay comfortable. As a runner the fear of them falling out was strong at first. However, after YEARS of using my first pair, I never once had that problem. On the road or the treadmill, for hours of running. After about 5 years my first pair finally gave up on life and I bought these and they are much the same and I feel they are worth the investment.

review title: easy to pair, terrible battery life
review_body: It is amazingly easy to pair these bluetooth earphones and to switch between devices, which is why I bought them. However, they are equally easy to knock out of your ears if you have long hair (so you may need to buy a cord to connect them and to hang around your neck). My biggest complaint is the cruddy standby battery life. If you leave them in your ears without any music playing the battery will still be dead in around 2 hours. That is no where near the 5 hours of music per charge promised by Apple! At this point I'm banking on durability to make up for the high price. If these die in 6 months like all my other bluetooth headphones I will be furious and go back to cheaper alternatives with better battery life.

Pretty sure these are a fake knockoff or just super defective. Bought them for my daughter for Christmas, she just heard me tell my husband I was going to order myself a pair & she told me I could have hers since she never sides them since they “too hard to use”. I asked her what she meant & she told me that they are difficult to pair to her phone & IF she can get them paired they always disconnect shortly after. And she’ll charge them for a few hours & when she goes to use them the battery is dead. Pretty bummed that we wasted almost $200 & it’s past the return window now.

Pros: great sound quality, amazing battery life, that closing snap 😩😩

Cons: not much noise cancellation cover wiggles a tiny bit

Other than the cons above, I don’t know why people are so upset about these AirPods. They’re literally just 2nd generation AirPods by Apple. They aren’t any cheaper built than regular AirPods you would’ve bought 3 - 4 years ago. Stop hating on them they work perfectly fine.

review title: Airpods are terrific. Should have gotten them long ago.
review_body: I bought the Apple Air pods not expecting much. But, I was impressed right away with the sound quality and ease of use. They pair very easily with my Apple iPad, iPhone and iMac. I find the sound tilted up a bit in the midrange. That works perfectly with my hearing roll-off. I can hear phone calls, videos, etc. way better now. They are great for my streaming my Bandcamp purchases and they even pair fairly well with my Hiby R3 Pro and Hidiz players. I am really glad I bought them. My only complaint is they are very slippery and I fuss trying to get them out of the charger (also slippery).

I actually own my own pair of AirPods but I decided to gift a pair on someone’s birthday. The package was perfectly sealed and did not think to open it and check. It was in the moment of opening gifts where it was noticed that no AirPods were found inside. It was an embarrassing moment for myself and I had to play it off as it was a cruel joke. Had to put out more money. Was going to order another pair but Amazon somehow no longer had them? I don’t understand how I can refund something but there was no product in it. Very disappointed.

The sound is really good they work pretty well they connect easily however the battery life is really bad I don’t know if these were refurbished or not but I’m glad I purchased the AppleCare insurance with them because I’m gonna have to take them in soon so that I know I got my moneys worth because the battery life is really bad and I’ve only had them for maybe two weeks and the battery lasts maybe an hour for the course of the day which is really bad so you may want to go to the Apple store I don’t know.

Excellent Product! I bought these airpods in new condition. I've been using for 4 weeks! I tend to use Bluetooth earbuds more than the average person because I'm always either making calls for work or am on Zooms and or conference calls from 8:30 am to about 9:45pm 6 days a week. If you already own an apple product and are in their ecosystem then these premium priced headphones are an invaluable purchase. If I knew they were this Good and would give added features to my Apple devices (iPhone 12 pro max & iPad 8th gen) then I would've paid their higher premium a long time ago. Lesson learned. If you're on the fence and are in the apple ecosystem my advice is to definitely get these airpods.

I'm very impressed with the AirPods. My wife has been wanting me to get a pair for years, but I resisted (I'm on Android, so I knew I'd lose a bit of functionality - my wife has an iPhone). But, I finally gave in when they had a good sale, and I love them. I wish there was a gesture that would "jump back" my playback, but at least double tap does a pause/play. Super comfortable, very long battery life, excellent sound quality. Even the charging case is excellent: not too small (to get lost), nice magnetic lid (doesn't open unless you want it to), good feel. The Apple designers know their ergonomics!

I’m hoping they work. Was very disappointed with the way they looked when I opened the box.
Not sure why these would be sent out like this .

These earbuds are great. I was hesitant to get them at first, fearing they would fall out of my ears or I would lose them. They are secure in my ears whenever I wear them and carrying them around in the charging case makes it less likely to lose them. I did forget about them in my pocket and ran them through the wash. I took them out and they played normally right away. I put them in rice for 72 hours and they still played fine.

I have used these with my iPhone XS, Windows 10 laptop and iPad and for all devices they work great.

I am still getting used to the commands/taps that come with these. I would like to find more info on that.

I bought these when they were under $100, which I felt was a steal. They are great to have!

review title: Don't waste your money and time on the knock-offs
review_body:
I avoided these at first because the off brands were so much cheaper. I was very disappointed in their sound quality though. I gave in and bought these. I don't know why there is a rating option for noise cancellation when these don't offer it.

Pros:
Wow, so much better range and clarity.
So much better controls by having voice access to Siri.
They fit great in my ears and are much more secure than I thought they would be.
So comfortable, I could wear all day.

Cons:
Battery life could be better, but having the ability to quick charge in the case helps.
Not available in black.
Should be more controls than double tap. Triple tap for volume would be helpful so you don't have to yell out "Hey Siri" in the office.

review title: Do yourself a favor and upgrade to the PROs
review_body: These KILLED my ears. I had my husband and daughter try them to see if it was just me, but they hurt their ears as well. It's like they are shaped wrong? The sound quality was what you would expect from W-mart specials. Def not worth the money. Do yourself a favor and upgrade to the PROs! They are way more comfortable and the sound quality is sooo much better. Plus the PROs have noise cancellation. I was glad that Amazon allowed me to return them!

review title: Painful... Most Uncomfortable Earbuds I've Tried
review_body:
I recently tried 8 different pair of earbuds. I wanted a pair that I could wear to the gym to listen to music while working out, but also be able to listen to music or news while working from home. Finally, as a secondary need, I wanted to be able to take calls on the earbuds too.

The sound quality of the AirPods 2 awesome. However, I can't enjoy the sound because the earbuds are extremely uncomfortable (even painful) for me to wear. Unfortunately, these are not a returnable item, so I am SOL. I'm looking into third party silicon tips to purchase, but at this price point I don't feel like I should have to.

Bottom line? I cannot recommend these. I can however recommend Anker Soundcore Life 1, which feature a great sound, a very comfortable fit, and a price that is less than 1/2 the AirPods!

review title: The sound is not as good as wired earbuds
review_body:
I hesitated a lot on reviewing this item for fear I wasn't being fair to the product, but I now can say with confidence that the sound out of these wireless airpods is definitely inferior to the wired earbuds for iphone. It's great that there are no wires attached and that's a plus. I use them mostly when I am watching some series on my ipad, while walking on the treadmill. As far as noise cancellation, it doesn't work because I can still hear the treadmill in the background. Could my airpods be defective? My son has a pair that he swears cancel all the outside noise, so maybe I got a floozie.
As an alternative, I am still using the wired earbuds while I walk on the treadmill

These were great for 5-3/4 months. Then the charging got wonky. Suddenly, after leaving the airpods charging overnight, one or the other airpod would give me a low battery warning 5 minutes after removing them from the case. Then the next charge would be fine. Repeat whole process. Very disappointed in this product. Because of COVID, I can't take them into the local Apple Store. Instead, I get a $220 hold on my credit card, and wait for a refurb unit. I should have the hold removed once they get my defective unit back. I won't buy these again. If you do buy them, I strongly recommend the AppleCare (which you must buy within the first 60 days of placing your order.)

Received first set of ear pods in original packaging opened case white flashing lite charged case w/ear pods in checked white lite still flashing ear pods no charge, but when ear pods out of case green light comes on so case charges but not ear pods. Asked for exchange sadly for me the exchange came the same way. Am I the only one who had this issue twice? Buyer beware! Amazon has been great they connected me with apple rep she could not help told me to get a refund.
I star rating I had none but could not post unit I rated star

Ok, I admit I tried to go the cheap route, not wanting to invest over $100 for earbuds, it's not in my wheelhouse, and I was afraid I'd lose them. Going with a cheap competitor was nothing but problems and was so frustrating I bit the bullet and got these.
What a game changer! Connecting between devices is seamless, battery life stellar and I've never been happier with a set of buds. These are with me all the time, going from android phone, MacBook, pc, and iPad is so convenient I hate I didn't get these in the first place. I would recommend!

Unpack them and open them next to your phone or ipad and they simply pair. I love how simple it is, i can jump them between my ipad and iphone with a simple 3 taps. I use them daily for music during walks but also for recorded audio of national parks and other ambiance that isn't very loud. I find they last me about 4-5 hours for music and 6-7 hours for a low volume recording. Drop them into the charging case and 20-30 min later they are ready to go again. I've never had ear buds or headphones that were so convenient.

These wireless earbuds are amazing. They have a smooth connection to your phone and the possibilities of what they can assist you in, in your everyday life to make things easier are endless. They make listening to music, podcasts, phone calls, and talking to Siri almost effortless. The 2nd generation Apple AirPods automatically connect to your phone through Bluetooth first thing when you open the wireless charging case. The wireless charging case charges your Airpods just by inserting them into their spots and closing the case. By charging your AirPods in the case for just fifteen minutes you have up to 3 hours of battery life in each AirPod. Another feature that comes with the AirPods is being able to customize certain things of the wireless earbuds to how you would like them. There are two ways you can customize them. The first one is by choosing what you'd like engraved on the case. The options of what you can engrave on them is limitless. Some common things people engrave on them are their name, phone number in case they were to lose them, or a favorite quote. The other way you can customize them is by the name you want them under. When your AirPods connect to your phone, it shows the name they are under on your phone screen and you can choose what you’d like that name to be. I love my 2nd Generation Apple AirPods and I can’t say enough good things about them. If you are looking for a reliable wireless earbud, these are definitely for you.

The sound quality is good (not great), the noise cancellation in noisy environment is mediocre, but the battery life for how I use is fine (usually only one to two hours at a time, then back in the case for immediate recharging). So, why the five star rating, because it works incredibly well with an iPhone, iPad, iMac, Apple Watch, no connection other than initial startup, instant recognition when you put it in your ear, great for phone conversation and zoom meetings, no wires (this is a huge deal), easily and comfortably fits in the ear for hours at a time. The case works great for hours of recharging before needing to plug it in and a great place to storage.

With the exclusion of the headphone jack on iphones, air pods are a necessity for listing to music on the go.
Although I disagree with that design decision, these airpods are great.

They look nice, sound nice as far as I can tell (not very picky to be honest), and they're really convenient to carry around. They also don't fall out of your ear (I have average ears I guess(?)) when you're exercising.

Although you can find bluetooth earbuds for less, they're not in sync with the Apple/iOS environment like AirPods are so you may as well buy these to fit in!

so these are real gen 2 air pods - the light on the outside means wireless charging case - light under the lid means wired charging case not gen 1 airpods, if you look on apple you can see this. also if you look on apple 2031 and 2032 is gen 2 airpods not gen 1- the 31 and 32 does not mean gen1 speaker and gen 2 speaker. don't believe it look on the apple website. yes some are getting used airpods but not me. these things are great.
Did not connect out of the box. Took it to Apple, and confirmed not authentic Apple AirPods.

To be honest I knew I would not like these before purchasing but I wanted to try something different (been using Beats X wireless since 2017) the wire makes them not so wireless. But anyway, so I decided to give them a try because they were on sale. Here is my issue with the AirPods and every other Apple headphone made....they hurt my ears. No seriously if I have these things in for more than 10 minutes, they hurt. Why not make something softer?

When these work they are awesome, but most of the time the right bud does not work. For a while I could get the right one to work by putting it back in the case for a few seconds, then putting it back in my ear, but that stopped working recently. Now I have to completely reset them every time to make sure I have sound on the right side, and even that isn't a guarantee. If I even pause my music, it can make the right bud stop working. The other day, the right bud had 0% charge even though they both had been in the case all day and the case still had more than 50% charge left. I've also been surprised at how quickly these lose charge when they do work. If you decide to get them, make sure to return them as soon as you start having issues otherwise you'll be stuck with a faulty product and out $150.

review title: The best in ear wireless headphones
review_body: Hands down the best wireless in ear headphones. Pairing with an Apple device is seamless, they auto pause/play when taking them out of your ear, they simply work all the time. Sound quality is very good. Battery life is excellent and lasts almost all day listening, shorter life if using for talking. But a quick 10-15 minute charge brings them back for use again. The only down side is they don’t block outside noise at all and are not great for air travel because of outside noise. I also have AirPod pros which are perfect for blocking out the background noise.

review title: Get these, you won't be sorry.
review_body:
After settling for cheaper bluetooth headphones, I finally took the plunge and purchased these. They far exceeded my expectations and I'll never go back. The only reason I marked 3 stars for noise cancellation is they really aren't built to do it--and they aren't supposed to.

Side note: I accidentally washed them in the case in the washing machine, they were fine.

review title: Don't waste your money like I did, buy some Beat Pro's.
review_body:
AirPods are over hyped, one of my worst buy that I ever made and here is my reason why.

1st- didn't not charge correctly-one side will charge to 100% and the other side would be at 2%. I tried everything in the book/youtube to make this work and nothing. It charge at 100% when it wanted to. This would hurt my workout times and had me super upset

2nd- sounds quality was horrible, wasn't loud at all and I could hear what was going on in the background. It just sucked

3rd- would fallout of my ears easily, any small bump and they're it went.

4th-waste of money

The only good thing that came out of this is that I'm now a proud owner of Beats Pro's. They worth every cent and I haven't had to go through any of the issues that I had with the AirPods.

I bought this for my Wife she have a iPhone for that's reason sound good they are comfortable in the ears
Things i don't like that much is not wireless charging case and not power break includes on the package and the case not have a light indicator outside just inside and you need to be open other time to checking out if their are charging or checking on your phone other brand have those things included and that is a letdown
If after you is you want to buy it

review title: Y’all r selling things that’s no good for ppl hard earned money..
review_body: These AirPods r crap I bought them for my daughter birthday I gave them to her 2days early on her birthday the right one didn’t work wouldn’t charge up r anything I want my money back r I’ll get a lawyer for a $150.

review title: Not worth it in the long run
review_body: They were wonderful earbuds when I first got them, but after a while the sound quality was worse and one side stopped working. They didn’t work for phone calls and I would find that one earbud would be playing my music along with the phone playing music aloud. I finally retired them (after only having them for 6ish months) when they were blasting music in a library. It would be a better investment to buy a brand like Tozo, but I will never be buying AirPods again. This was my second pair in the last year (I treat my technology very well) and they are not worth it.

review title: Older generation airpods are still a good bet!
review_body: The airpods were on my daughter's Christmas wish list. Her old ones were beginning to show some wear and tear in terms of sound quality after 4 years. She didn't want the super new ones, which worked for my wallet! She was excited to get them and told me she is very happy she got them. She says the sound is so good! I say, if the older ones are still good and giving good sound, I would not just go with the new model just because it's new!

review title: I got these for my husband
review_body: My husband is ill and spends a lot of time in doctors offices and hospital waiting rooms.....hours and hours. In the old days I would go with him and we would chat, but now in Covid land I am not allowed in the hospital or doctors offices.....And I am sure you have all had the experience of the crazy lady who can spend hours chatting on her cell at the top of her voice. It is torture. So I purchased these for my husband to drowned out her voice and stay calm listening to music. The perfect solution for drowning out people who don't realize that waiting rooms are for waiting, not sharing your entire life with everyone around you. Highly recommend.

Got these as a present.

Pros:
Best connection out of any Bluetooth headphones. Hands down.
Decent mic for calls
Comfortable for most people
Reliable

Cons:
Sound quality is fair. Not terrible, but not great either.
Should include wing tips.
Should come with charging block.

Overall, these are convenience Bluetooth headphones. If you want simple reliability, these can't be beat, but be aware, there are plenty at this price point with better audio quality, but generally lack a strong Bluetooth connection, compared to airpods.

review title: Once you go Apple Air-bud you can’t go back!!
review_body: With all honesty, and fairness. Kid u not before I purchased these Apple earbuds. I purchased more than 8, different types of earbuds, spend a lots coin’s. All had different effective problems. But when I decided to go with Apple air-buds. I wish I could get all my money back from all the others. There is a saying, once you go black you can’t go back. Mine is once you go Apple Air Buds, you can’t go back to anything else!! And that is the fact!

I wish I would’ve returned these while I still had the open window, now too late. The batteries are constantly running low. When I charge the actual case it seems the battery gets drained & then when I think it’s fully charged the ear buds are fully dead. Constantly disconnects from allowing me to see the battery percentage & when I do get to use it usually only connects to the right bud and not the left. Super annoying, I hate these and now I’m stuck with them. I used to have a great set from apple but my dog chewed them so I thought purchasing these from Amazon would be a great replacement, wrong! The sound is great and same to my old ones just the battery & constant disconnect is the issue.

review title: Great sound, perfect for remote working
review_body: With COVID forcing my employer to send us all home to work remotely. I was using my gym headphones for conference calls. I finally decided to give in and purchase some Airpods after I came to terms with the "new normal". (I can't fully express my distaste for that phrase "new normal"). Anyway, I digress, I was skeptical if they would stay in my ears comfortably as I have ALWAYS had issues with headphones staying in while working out. They work perfectly for both conference calls and gym time. My calls are clear for both myself and those listening, and when I work out (and run) they stay in without me having to mess with them. Also, with my pumpkin spice lattes, Ugg boots, and now Airpods I can truly take my "basic" look to a whole new level!

I bought these instead of the $250.00 new model because I don't like things sticking in my ear canal. I have owned 2 or 3 pairs of various brands that stick in your ear canal. They were all uncomfortable. These hang in your ear, you almost can't feel them. The sound is just awesome. I am a retired Electrical Engineer. I worked with a lot of sound equipment over the years. This style of earbud, and the wired version of the same shape, is something Apple did right. I would have bought the $250.00 model if it hung instead of having to be jammed in your ear canal.

I ordered these on Prime day because I just couldn’t resist. My package arrived a day before the estimated date so I couldn’t be more excited. Great so far except I can’t seem to get the double tap function down. I’m not sure if it’s not working properly or if it may just be user error. Also, it states in the product description that this IS the WIRED version. It seems that there may be confusion about this feature. This has been my first day using them and I will make sure to update this review if anything changes. These AirPods appear to be authentic after verifying the serial # on the official checkcoverage.apple.com site. It states they are indeed the 2nd generation., I’m not sure if people are getting used/ refurbished AirPods after sending them back as a return, but mine seemed to be in the original packaging and untouched.

ordered these the 1st day they were available and received them today. They connected easily but on the 1st song I played the audio started slowing down less than a minute in and distorted the vocals and music. I thought maybe it’s just a glitch because they are only 75% charged so I charged them up and reconnected them and it was even worse than before. I called Apple support and spoke to 2 women who were beyond slow and the opposite of geniuses. I was told the 2nd one was a senior supervisor not sure what her qualifications were as she was as inept and unhelpful as her subordinate. After 37 minutes on the call timer and being on hold over 5x I hung up. I’m going to the Apple store tomorrow. So I went to the Apple store and with help from the guys there we were able to determine the music issue only happens with Amazon music - which is my service of choice. I’ve been checking everyday for an update to fix this glitch. Apple said they will take them back if one doesn’t come out in the next week or so. I hate being a casualty in someone’s else’s war....😕
Alright there is a workaround - Settings-Amazon Music-Turn Microphone to Off. Then when you pull up Amazon Music deny permission for microphone access for Alexa. It fixes the distortion issue when playing music but then I have to turn it back on when I’m using it in the car. So I’m updating my rating from 2 stars to 3 stars. If they release an update so I can use Alexa again I’ll raise it up higher.

We now own 3 pair of apple air pods. I have purchased other brands of earbuds and the sound and battery life don’t hold up to the apple brand. Don’t waste your money on a less expensive brand. You will get what you paid for. I also love the fact that I can talk to Siri through these without having to dig out my phone and the caller on the end can hear me just fine. My husband owns a different brand of earbuds and when Im on on the phone while he’s wearing them, it sounds like he’s under water and I can’t understand what he’s saying. These are definitely worth the money.

I did not care for the way these fit in my small ears. But I was committed to making them work because they weren’t cheap. My first outside walk I adjusted my hat and the right one fell out into the snow. There’s only one thing harder than finding a needle in a haystack. Finding a white AirPod in a snow bank. I hadn’t registered them in the cloud so I couldn’t ask for where they were and I don’t think I could have found them anyway. So $129 down the shoot. I purchased another brand that loop around my ears and I like them a lot better so I guess it’s OK.

review title: My Favorite Thing to Constantly Lose!
review_body:
I know what you're thinking. Use that little Apple app thing and you can find these in a flash. Here's where things get weird. I don't have an iPhone. I have an Android phone. What does that mean? It means that every time I pop one of these babies out and put them down, IT'S EASTER IN MY HOUSE!!!

Is the air pod under the couch? Nope!
Is it on the window sill? Nope!
Did I leave it on the counter at the store? Nahhhhh!
In the bathroom? Not there either!
I guess I'll just go and get the other one out of the case for now.... SON OF A!!!!!!!!!!

I bought my airpods on Feb. Didn't use them until March because it was a present for my hubby, well now I was listening to them and the right air pod went dead. I figured, maybe I just need to charge them. So when I got home I charged them, and the next day I went to use them again and the right air bud was still dead.
I put them to charge and when I went to retrive them from the case I notice the one with the issue was stuck and felt very hot, it overheated (melted) and now it's completed dead. Very dissapointed.
I chatted with an Amazon customer service and explained the problem and he was a ble to assist me and said he would send a repacement and exchange the bad ones for some working airpods;He made my day. Thank you Amazon

review title: Great Apple AirPods with Charging Case (Latest model)
review_body:
I got this set of Apple AirPods to replace my version 1 that started to give out after one year of usage.

Either the iOS updates or just the 1st generation going out. Oh well.

Anyways, I got the 2nd version for $129 at Amazon.

It was brand new, sealed and works great.

However, you all should know. The 2nd version uses battery out of the charging case much more / faster. I have noticed that I do not get the amount of charges out of the charging case as with my 1st generation.

I guess, welcome to updates. The sound is good, could be better, thought.

I love the touch actions on the AirPods of the 1st & 2nd generation versus "squeezing" the AirPods of the Pro version.

i got these and i dont hate them. of course they look cool and give you bonus popularity points, however there are a few things that i personally dont like. as the battery life goes does, so does the sound quality. i know it might just be a way to tell u to charge them but its honestly annoying. second thing: the charging. ik its easier than having to detangle earbud strings but having to charge them is annoying. other than that these things work well and this is a safe place for buying them

review title: These are so worth the expense!
review_body: I resisted buying these for quite awhile because I didn’t want to spend the money. So I bought cheaper wireless earbuds that didn’t have the sound quality I wanted. I decided to ask my husband for them for Christmas. These have the most amazing sound I can’t believe it. I talk on the phone with people and it sounds like the person I’m talking to is standing right in front of me. Not to mention how easy they were to pair and work which is typical of Apple. I ended up buying a pair for my husband. These are the best. Don’t hesitate to buy them.

I was replacing lost AirPods, as they work so well, and are superior to several other brands I’ve tried. But I am truly disappointed that the Airpod’s case refuses to hold a charge. Left plugged in, it only achieves a 5% charge. Though the AirPods hold the charge hey are supposed to, the case is no back up at all. Will not buy from this seller again.

review title: These are BRAND NEW SECOND GENERATION AIRPODS
review_body:
I received a brand new set of AirPods from this seller. The Model Number of the pair is A2031, which is the 2nd generation model. The Hardware Version is 1.0.0. (To get this information, open your AirPod case near your iPhone, then on your iPhone, go to Settings > General > About and scroll down to where your AirPod is listed and click on it to get the hardware/firmware information.)

I'm disappointed that the battery doesn't last any longer than the first generation set I owned. They go dead before the end of two back-to-back conference calls. I haven't tried listening to music with them, so I have no idea how long they'd last doing that.

None of that is this seller's fault. These AirPods are being accurately portrayed here on Amazon as far as I can tell.

Sound quality is about the same as the wired ear pods. They fit my ears perfectly. I could wear them all day with no problem. I've actually forgotten that I was wearing them a few times. I like the convenience of not having to re-pair them across IOS devices. What I dont like is the latency. The sound is almost a second behind youtube videos played on my macbook. The battery life is terrible. I get about 5 hours even if I dont have audio playing through them the entire time. I bought these to complement my Anker Soundcore Liberty Pro 2's which sound way better than the airpods but hurt my ears due to the tips being jammed into my ear canal.

I can’t believe I’ve waited so long to buy these AirPods for myself. I borrowed my sons to go to the gym and I was hooked. I checked on line and Amazon had the best price, shipped in one day! Came sealed in original Apple packaging, they work beautifully, sound super crisp! Same 2nd Generation as my sons. No charging light in front, no problem, light on inside case. Comes with charging cord. I bought the silicon case in picture and keep them on my keychain.

I have ridiculously small ears. I always have a problem finding earbuds/pods that fit snug and don't hurt my ears. These work ok. Noise cancellation and sound is actually really good, I use them mostly when walking the dog. The battery life seems decent as well. They haven't fallen out of my ears, but definitely became loose when just walking - not crazy walking, just leisurely walking my small dog. I've tried adjusting them in my ear every which way, but I just can't get that really snug fit. I've gone on to purchase silicone ear hooks to help, and so far those work just so-so for me.

These are awesome! I bought these for work when I had to make over 1,500 calls in 2 weeks. (I am a recruiter for a university & I was calling inquiries). Ever since then I wear them for work when making calls or listening to music and podcasts. They’re also super convenient when cleaning the house or having a long call with family members when you want to move around.
I wouldn’t recommend for working out. With that said I am beats loyalist because they have better sound quality and stick in my ears better.

You get about 90 days before they fail. Some probably have better luck, I've had one set returned and waited around two months for an exchange and almost 90 days to the exchange these failed too.

Amazon says "contact the manufacturer", well that's a waste. I'd advise purchasing directly from the Apple Store or Apple, no need to play in the middle with Amazon.

$119, you'd expect at least a year of operation, I've two sets in about 8 months both fail.

Got these back when they were on sale. Works very well with my phone. The case lasts for a long time, never ran out of power to charge them up. Doesn’t block out sound too well but works alright as long as your not being yelled at or around heavy equipment. Take full use of having one bud in while the other charges for long phone calls or using as a mic in gaming apps. Every once in a while one of them becomes disconnected and won’t connect back but unpairing and repairing fixes the issues. They tend to last two to three hours after a full charge after heavy use. I do recommend to apple users after trying out four other brands of true wireless headphones. Not much for bass but just enough to hear it bump.

review title: Wore it for 24 hours and experienced some progress. Still the best one
review_body:
The airpods 2 inherit the first generation design, and the appearance is almost the same as the old model. Same color, same material. But this time, apple put difference in the details.
1. Long battery life. It can last for 24 hours with fully charged. And the new charging box improves the charging efficiency of the headset. 15 mins box' charging can get up to 3 hours of listening and 2 hours of talking. It is 1 hour longer than the first generation airpods.
2. Faster connection speed. After adding the H1 chip,there is a big increase in connection speed when pairing devices. When pairing and devices switching, airpods 2 will respond twice as fast as the old model. It is easy to feel that.
The airpods 2 remain the best wireless earbuds on the market.

review title: These are only suitable for low gravity situations
review_body:
I wanted these for running but they don't even stay in my ears while sitting at my desk and there seem to be no provided options for adjusting them to fit. I tried the various DIY methods to make them stay but I can only conclude they are made for space travel (only after attaining cruise velocity--no acceleration at all).

The sound quality is great but I gave them to my daughter who liked them for a couple hours. She regularly has to re-pair them to get them both working again. Between that and the low battery life, she has given up using them.

These are great. i got them after i was very letdown by the galaxy earbuds (the ones that look like beans). fit in your ears great, stay in, after awhile i forget i have them in at all. the case will charge the buds. this is the OG model so its not wireless charging but worth saving the extra cash if you can handle just plugging them in. They have some cool features and if you pop one out your music/podcast stops playing which is a cool feature.

the noise cancelling isnt great but i also dont think they advertise them with that feature.

10/10 would buy again

review title: Only works great with apple devices. Very bad quality with windows or google devices
review_body:
Only works great with apple products. When you try to use with google Samsung galaxy note, the sound is very low and you can’t increase it. With Windows computers the sound also average. So you couldn’t use this headset for business meetings if you have windows P.C.
I think they make it on purpose so it only works great with apple products.

When I use cheap headset with Samsung and windows devices, the sound 10 times better.

I wanted the wireless earbuds to avoid tripping over my cords while listening to music at home, and was so surprised by how much more these little gadgets had to offer. The design works seamlessly with Apple devices, pausing when you take an earbud out to talk to someone, pairing effortlessly, and the sound and function is fantastic. I also use these with a windows computer for online meetings. It was a little clunky to set up at first, but they work great now for online meetings in a shared office space. The first time I connected them, they were very loud even on the lowest volume, but after disconnecting them and pairing a second time, they work great for the windows computer as well. So glad that I spent a little extra on these wireless AirPods.

I can’t figure out how else to get a message to you. I used your UPS return label and inadvertently dropped it off at the US post office on Sunday. When I realized my error, I went to the post office today and they told me it would be shipped on to you via USPS and I would be charged postage at your end, which is fine. I don’t know what else to do to get this back on track. I returned them because I do not have the manual dexterity to get them in and out of the case and into my ears.

I was excited to finally get these airpods, but they are so uncomfortable to wear (even for an hour). The ear pieces are too big, which causes too much pressure around the inner part of my ears. Disappointing because the sound and call quality is great. I do like that the airpods easily connect to my Nexus 5X and older imac before I upgrade. The key to connecting an android device for first time with the airpods is to keep them in the case, press/hold the white button on the case while turning on phone bluetooth. Took a few tries, but now instantly connects.

I loved this product, it’s too comfortable, I don’t even realize I’m wearing it. The only defect is not to connect automatically, between my Apple devices, for example, when I want to use on the computer, and it was connected to the phone, I have to force the connection, the same when I want to use it on the phone again. To really get better, it was if the product could be connected to two devices at the same time.

Me encantó este producto, es demasiado cómodo, ni siquiera sé que lo estoy usando. El único defecto es no conectarme automáticamente, entre mis dispositivos Apple, por ejemplo, cuando quiero usarlo en la computadora, y estaba conectado al teléfono, tengo que forzar la conexión, lo mismo cuando quiero usarlo en el teléfono de nuevo. Para mejorar realmente, era si el producto se pudiera conectar a dos dispositivos al mismo tiempo.

I bought these for my daughter who has a difficult time finding ear buds that fit comfortably in her ears. We have tried many different types and none fit well enough to be comfortable or stay in her ears. A friend let her try one of their AirPods and she loved the feel and that it stayed in place. Definitely more expensive than I’d like to spend for earbuds but worth it after going through so many other kinds. She is very impressed with the sound quality compared to cheaper versions as well.

I purchased 2 of these units one for my husband, the other for myself. Love them oh so much! They sound quality crispy clear. Noise cancellation is on point as well. They are extremely comfortable, most times I forget I’m even wearing them. Lol. My husband has fallen asleep several times with them in, talk about comfort. Great price as well, highly, highly recommend buying. It’s a great idea being wireless since you get endless possibilities, and no restrictions. Get them already!

I love working late at night painting and listening to my jams as high as I want ..loud enough so my ears won’t cry blood but in all seriousness BEST bang for your buck these ones! Now I don’t answer my door when someone is knocking, I don’t hear the cars when I drive and now I have no friends lol music is all you need

review title: ONLY for use with other Apple products
review_body: No way to control the volume on these if you use them with a Fitbit versa. AMAZING that you need to be connected to an apple iphone or watch to control the volume. Too many other great options out there to force me to buy an Apple watch just to use these ear buds.

Bought these in June for a Christmas gift for my granddaughter. They were packaged as new. She opened, charged and tried them. Right one doesn't work. We went to Apple for help. Did everything but no luck in getting the issue resolved. Kicking myself for not opening to make sure they worked. BUT, they were packaged as new & I didn't think I should have needed to do a check. Now it's too late for exchange and I'm out the $ AND my granddaughter is super disappointed. 😭😠

review title: Good but not for small ears
review_body:
This was the first time I spent a lot of money on earphones which was something unnerving for me.
Because I’m broke hahaha
But I bought these mainly to workout or when I just wanted to enjoy watching videos or whatever.
When I received them they were amazing and I loved these immediately.
The only thing that I noticed how that it’s been 4 months is that since I have very small ears they have been prone to slip out very easily.
I swear a lot and again I have small ears so if you’re like me then it might be a difficult choice for you as they have fallen off my ear many times already.
They sound amazing and last pretty long as I have been able to use these for online school and they last pretty much the whole day except the last period. Which is pretty impressive for something so small.

Because of my job, I've had to deal with wearing bluetooths for the majority of the last 10 years, and I've detested every moment of it! After an hour of having the old style in, I'd be forced to move the bluetooth device to my other ear as they were literally painful. I got very tired of wearing bluetooth devices, to say the least. After reading the comments regarding the Gen 2 airpods, I decided to take a gamble and buy them. Am I glad I did! I've only had them for one week, but the comfort of wearing them is off the chart, the sound quality is unbelievable, and the fact that the charging case will keep them available to me is wonderful. I took them to a friend's house last night and let him try them. He's always been a huge audiophile and prior to putting them in his ears voiced his skeptimism as to how good these ""Itty-bitty" airpods could possibly be. To make a long story short, I had to almost fight him to get my airpods back! Lol! He let me know that he would be purchasing a pair of his own in the near future, and made mention of how unbelievably comfortable they were as well, and he had them in for a couple of hours at least. My $144.95 gamble definitely paid off, and I am very happy I made the jump to Apple!

review title: Best gift I’ve ever received better than Bose earbuds!!!!
review_body:
Absolutely the best thing I’ve ever gotten for Christmas! These were for my daughter but my husband got me the same pair they work so WELL! I use them when cooking, when cleaning, when doing laundry, on my walks. Highly recommend -
In fact my husband has Bose wireless earbuds he says these sound better and are more comfortable in the ears and his were 2x as much in cost!!!!!!! Buy a pair u won’t be sorry!!!

review title: Not a fan of Apple..until now
review_body: I am the only one in my family that is still uses Android. My work phone is Apple and I hate it. However the wired headphones that come with the phone are used continuously even on my Android. I got tired of getting the wires caught on everything so I finally bought these. Omg what was I waiting for?! I am super picky about earbuds and I bought this older version because they are the same as wired. I know I wouldn't like the pro version. Anyway, the sound quality is amazing, even better than the wired. I forget they are in my ears. Pairing them with my Android was super easy. Love them and worth every penny!

They came sealed and pretty much charged i am assuming they are new. I read all the reviews about people getting used ones so i was skeptical. The sound is a bit low but it could be due to the noise limiting i have activated it sounds louder when i turn it off. They don’t seem to stay connected i will reset them and see how it works. They also do not seem to stay charged long. I had to reach out to apple in order to purchase apple care because it told me the Amazon purchase date was invalid. Being that the return date has been extended i will try them out and see how it goes. They don’t seem as loud as wired EarPods.

AirPods are definitely very convenient to use, especially if you like to listen to music or videos while you’re working/moving around. Sound quality is standard and pretty much the same as the wired earbuds. The battery life is really good and you could listen for the entire day relatively uninterrupted if you use one AirPod and swap when the battery runs low. Even when I don’t use them for several days, the battery doesn’t drain so they can last a long while if you leave them around. However, there’s a frustrating issue that I’ve encountered more times than should be acceptable for rather highly priced earbuds. This is mostly relevant if you tend to only use one earbud at a time though; it’s not a major issue if you normally use both at the same time.

The first pair I ordered came brand new and sealed, but within a few hours, they had already stopped working properly. The right AirPod would not connect unless the left was also in use. Troubleshooting guides suggested resetting the AirPods, reconnecting, testing on other devices, and etc., but nothing fixed the issue, and it was consistent throughout multiple devices (iPhone, iPad, PC). I ended up returning these and requesting a replacement.

The second pair I received, which is the one I currently own, worked fine for the first couple weeks. However, the issue from the previous pair started occurring with these as well. I decided to keep these despite the problem because unlike the first set, these seemed to function properly at least sometimes, so they weren’t consistently dysfunctional. Resetting the AirPods also temporarily resolves the issue, but this isn’t the most convenient thing to do when it 1. happens rather frequently (pretty much daily) and 2. I have a case, and you need to hold onto the button on the back of the charging case to reset/reconnect. Also, weirdly enough, this pair had the connection issues with both AirPods. Sometimes the right wouldn’t work without the left, and other times the left wouldn’t work without the right. It’s probably a weird coincidence, but it always seems like the one I want to use at any given moment is the earbud that doesn’t want to connect without the other.

Anyway, I kept the second pair because they were functioning well enough, and I had purchased them for $99 which I guess isn’t too awful for brand new and legitimate Apple AirPods. But if the price was higher and I knew about this connectivity issue, which seems to be rather common judging from all the troubleshooting forums I found, I probably wouldn’t make the purchase.

review title: A little disappointed but it turned out okay in the end.
review_body: Unfortunately, I had to request a refund because the AirPods would not connect to any of my devices. I thought that I could save a few bucks by purchasing the AirPods that were used but in good condition as they were supposed to be verified to work but this wasn’t the case. I ended up requesting a refund on the used pair and ordering AirPods that were brand new on the same night. The brand new pair worked great. Fortunately, even if you buy the “used in good condition” ones that are verified by the seller and they do not work the return/refund process was very easy.

review title: Sound great and work perfect so far.
review_body:
First of all, they’re legit & REAL AirPods -I got sold a pair of pretty real looking knock offs from a cell phone store in PERSON, so don’t be like me and be naive, there’s a tonnnn of people out there selling knock offs that look very similar... I verified the serial numbers on these through Apples website and all came back just fine.

It should be noted these are NOT the wireless charging ones, however. I made a mistake and overlooked this in the description as some others have also, but I’m not bothered by it at all really.

Worth investing in the 2 year Apple Care plan for the additional $29 or $30... if you’re already dropping $120 on a pair of headphones, may as well invest in the coverage... esp in my case, I can see accidentally misplacing one or something lol.

Overall, very happy with this product and received within one day. They sound great and definitely worth the money.

review title: Do not work with Skype for Business
review_body:
Pros:
Decent sound
Easy to use
Sleek design
Long battery life

Cons:
Uncomfortable
Do not work with Skype for Business

I bought these so I would not be tethered to my desk when I am on Skype calls. I guess I should have researched better as they do not work for this purpose. I also found them to uncomfortable but I do not like the normal Apple headphones either. I would imagine if you liked the original Apple corded headphones you will like these as they are similar.

review title: I Love My Air Pods! (Don't wear dangly earrings)
review_body: I bought "regular" air pods vs the noise cancelling air pods only because noise cancelling devices don't fit my weird ears. I love my air pods because I can listen to music or call people without interference from a long cord. The sound is clear and, as a woman running at various hours of the day, I can still hear other sounds that would make me aware/beware. However, if I wear dangly earrings while walking and talking to someone, the other person hears the "click-click" sound of my earrings. No Big Deal. I've learned to take off my earrings while walking and talking.

review title: Falls out during workouts, great sound quality
review_body: Sound quality is really great, but does that matter when I’m exercising and the left one falls out and they stop playing? Flat or incline chest press - left one out. Abs - you better believe they fall out, etc etc. So, my kid is taking these and I’m going back to my 4 year old mpow wired bluetooth which won’t fall out. Bottom line, if you don’t do much physical activity and you just something while at your desk or just sitting or walking around these will be perfect.

These Apple AirPods are the finishing touches to my Apple Product collection. Now the family is complete (Apple iPhone 11 Pro Max, Apple iWatch, and iPad Pro). I’m so happy that I ordered them. It switches automatically from my iPhone to my iPad just by pressing play on what I want to watch or listen to without me having to unlink and link them. Plus, I can have Siri operate my AirPods (Start/Stop, Volume up/down, Skip track). I can use either the Left or Right AirPod separately without the other. I can check the battery 🔋 level for either/both AirPods by just putting the Charging case close to my iPhone. And little box shows up on the screen. I’m not sure what other features “if any” that they have, but I’m fine with what I’ve see so far. Money well spent. I love them.

review title: If you're questioning if you should, the answer is yes
review_body: I really, really debated on whether or not I wanted to spend the money on these. I regret not buying them sooner. I tried the knockoffs and they sucked but these... These are perfect. They hold a charge. I mean, really hold a charge. I keep my charging cable at my desk and unplugged it one day and forgot to plug it back in. For a whole week I kept plugging the case into the unplugged charging cord. A whole week. I mean, I don't use them constantly but I definitely have them on for a couple hours most days. The sound is phenomenal. No complaints. If you're like me and you can't use most headphones because they insert into your ear and questioning the cost, just do it, you won't regret it.

I’ve tried another brand with much lower cost (around $40), but I don’t like them at all due to its poor quality accords all spectrums, then I returned it and purchased the Apple Airpods ($130), and it definitely standout without comparison, the sound quality is awesome, and setup is just a snap of finger, and Bluetooth connection is quick with just a click away. I do agree that Apple products are pricey, but sometime it’s worth the money with the quality built from Apple company.

review title: Apple extorts $ again by over complicating iphone!
review_body:
The earphones that came with my iphone 11 would not maintain a constant volume. Desperate to listen to music Apple has designed a way to force you to buy the airpods. But $29.00 for corded ear phones that last non stop vs $129.00 for airpods that usually discharge in 3 hours. Profit margin for Apple!

I have owned these 4 months. I use them almost daily. Keep them in their case when not in my ears. It seems charging is not going well after only 4 months. Very frustrating to open your air pod case and find your right side only charged 3% and won’t hook up via bluetooth? The left side has presented some of the same issue. Really crappy when they falter after 4 months?

These are a game changer. Such great quality. They are comfortable and battery lasts a long time. I always keep mine in my case so my AirPods are always charged and I charge my case every couple of days. When it does need to be charged, they charge really fast!

review title: Maybe some things you shouldn’t buy used??
review_body: I bought a used “good” condition pair of AirPods from the Amazon warehouse for my little cousin’s birthday and they are a mess😂. It’s laughable these are “good” condition they look bad like old and used. I tried to connect them to my iPhone to se if they worked since I’m gonna paint them anyway so could sea With them being not good looking but one of them didn’t even work. sending them back and just gonna pay the extra $30 for a brand new pair. At least Amazon had brand new ones at a good price

review title: Okay, pay for the Apple compatibility not the quality
review_body:
Everyone loves these, I just like them. The pros are that they connect immediately to an iPhone, no issues. If you use an ipad they can transition sound from iPhone to the ipad. The Cons, they make an annoying clicking sound on phone calls. It’s constant and very annoying. The sound clarity is okay for $100 plus item. The battery is poor, they last four hours, without constant use. You must charge these every two or so hours.
I have a set of Taotronics ear pods that are half the price and hold a charge for eight hours, but they drop connection a lot.

I have been searching for wireless earbuds for a good amount of time and surprisingly I am really satisfied with my purchase. (My phone is an iPhone 6 Plus roughly 4 years old)

Things I was looking for in wireless earbuds
-sound quality
-fast connectivity
-battery life
-sound quality when making phone calls/mic sound
All of these were fulfilled when I tried it out.

I was really surprised on how fast the airpods connect and how I can easily tell that they are on. It makes a sound when you put them in your ear. I don't have to check my phone to see if they are connected or not. I do not need a specific app to control the sound quality like other wireless earbuds. I was also surprised on how easy it was to check the battery life of both the case and the earbuds. Just have to open the case and see the screen and the battery life will show up on the bottom of the screen. Some earbuds do not have the greatest mic when making phone calls. You will not come across problems like that when using these airpods. Battery life lasts a good amount for me. I usually only use one out of the two airpods, when one of them starts going low in battery i just switch over to the other airpod. There is no struggle in trying to reconnect with the airpods just have to pop them in your ear. Also if the airpods are low in battery it does fast charge when you put them in the case so it will easily charge half way within 15 or so minutes. No sound leaks as well when using them even if your music is really loud.

Overall A+++ purchase. Would recommend to anyone looking for wireless earbuds.

Recommendation for breaking in your new AirPods straight out of the lovely packaging: Luke Evans’ newish album “At Last”. I have been enjoying this album for weeks, with plain old ear buds. But with AirPods, this album is something entirely different and unexpected, a truly astounding experience. I am now in awe of the musicians. But it is Evans’ positively wrenching expressiveness, completely lost on me with cheap earbuds and speakers, that now, empowered by AirPods, pulled my very heart right out of my chest through my ears. Bravo, Apple! Bravo, Luke Evans!

I am not if it is just me, my airpods make cracking sound time to time when I was making phone call, the quality of sound is okay, the battery life is great, it lasts 3-4 days each charge.
